Breathing symptom reports

Male, 40 - 59 years

Age Reported Symptoms Notes
40 2020-12-31 shortness of breath Breathing difficulty-treated with nebulized medication. Received some relief after breathing treatm... Read more
Close
Breathing difficulty-treated with nebulized medication. Received some relief after breathing treatment. I am on day 2 of having to take breathing treatments. Had fever as high as 102 degrees. I have been sweating profusely for 3 days. I had one night of hallucinating dreams and hardly slept at all. I had all of the general side effects, fatigue, headache, muscle pain, joint pain, chills. I had a rapid heartbeat.
40 2021-01-13 shortness of breath Dose 1 was given to me on 12/30/20. Arm was sore at injection site x2 days which was fine. On 1/12/2... Read more
Close
Dose 1 was given to me on 12/30/20. Arm was sore at injection site x2 days which was fine. On 1/12/21 I experienced SOB/labored breathing for approximately 24 hours. O2 sat did not go below 95%. HR was between 80 and 105 for approximately four hours (75 is a typical resting heart rate). No history of asthma, but I felt how people with asthma describe difficulty breathing. Given the length of time between the dose and the SOB, I don't know if it's related to the vaccine. But I am submitting this just in case you end up with other, similar reports. Thank you.
40 2021-01-17 shortness of breath Beginning night of 1/13 around 9pm, felt cold chills, nausea, headache, body & muscle aches, loss of... Read more
Close
Beginning night of 1/13 around 9pm, felt cold chills, nausea, headache, body & muscle aches, loss of appetite and fever. Tight chest and hard to breathe. Feels like asthma attack was triggered. Has been persistent symptoms since 1/13. Have been alternating Tylenol and Motrin. Using albuterol pump and vicks vaporizer, as needed.
40 2021-01-25 shortness of breath Normally sore following the vaccine starting around 9:00 PM last night. Had shivers, nothing terrib... Read more
Close
Normally sore following the vaccine starting around 9:00 PM last night. Had shivers, nothing terrible. By 6:00 AM the chills were intense, weakness, having less coordination and depth perception issue. Closer to 9:00-10:00 AM felt like he had the flu 10 times worse than he should have. Had COVID in April/May but these symptoms worse. Got home at 11:15 AM was so cold, hands were ice cold, and took 2 hours of sleeping and all layers of clothing to feel warm. Took a few layers off and still shaking, feverish and feeling of worse flu to man. Pain all over the body, temperature at 3:30 is 99.5-100.4, above 98 is fever is fever for him, normal is 96-97. Sharp shooting muscle pains in extremities, top part of the hands, muscles, tendons, and also his legs and feet, but not fingers or toes. Pain is quite intense. All he wants to do is lay down in sleep. Thought he was going to freeze to death. Hands were so cold his kids were concerned. Ice packs on chest, and gloves and 10 layers on hands and arms. Had tremendous trouble breathing while having the intense chills. He is a responder for law enforcement. Symptoms have improved some, but still feeling feverish with shooting pains, depth perception issues, as well as pain. Headache in back of head, pressure type. Called off for work for today and tomorrow.
40 2021-01-27 shortness of breath Shortness of breath developed the same evening and lasted for 1.5 days
40 2021-02-03 shortness of breath Patient received the vaccine on 1/18/21. He awoke early on 1/20/21 with nasal congestion. By that ... Read more
Close
Patient received the vaccine on 1/18/21. He awoke early on 1/20/21 with nasal congestion. By that afternoon, he was having difficulty breathing. He was evaluated at Hospital outpatient clinic and sent to the Hospital Emergency Department. On arrival he was placed on oxygen and given a rapid COVID-19 test and COVID-19 PCA test which were both negative. He was also provided pulmonology consult. He was admitted and remained unable to maintain adequate oxygen sats without 10L oxygen until 1/22/21 late in the evening when he abruptly no longer needed oxygen. He was provided steroids initially. Ceftriaxone IV was added. Respiratory therapy provided ipratropium inhalation and vest therapy. He improved rapidly 1/23/21 and was released from the hospital on 1/24/21.
40 2021-02-07 respiratory rate increased 3:15 - Pt was leaning against wall c/o being dizzy and going to pass out - Pt was moved to reclining... Read more
Close
3:15 - Pt was leaning against wall c/o being dizzy and going to pass out - Pt was moved to reclining position - BP 144/100, RR 44, HR 120 - No itching ect. - Respirations rapid - O2 62 - Cannula applied - Pt continued c/o thinking he would pass out - Color pink - 3:15 1 cc Benedryl administered in R arm - 3:27 Epi 1 dose (0.7 cc) administered in R thigh - 3:30 EMS arrived - 3:34 EMS transferred pt to Medical Center
40 2021-02-09 shortness of breath, wheezing Received the following symptoms starting 15 hours after the vaccine. Full body fatigue. Could not s... Read more
Close
Received the following symptoms starting 15 hours after the vaccine. Full body fatigue. Could not stand up for two hours from my bed. This was followed by body aches pains and chills. It also included heightened skin sensitivity. Physical touch and contact on anywhere but my palms in the pads of my feet was extremely painful. The best example I can give is, taking a shower was like getting shot at by multiple BB gun pellets. At 1450 PST, I experience shortness of breath and wheezing. Struggled to walk up 12 steps. Continued with migraine. Weakness in body. Pain and body. Skin sensitive until about 36 hours after the vaccine. Did not try walking up and down stairs again, but breathing was slightly challenged Until about 30 hour mark. Struggled with migraines from The 24 hour mark until the 48 hour mark.It was the weekend. I did not go in. I just graded it out. Fatigue lasted all the way until the 48 hour mark. Funny enough? I did not developed a sore arm symptom.
40 2021-02-18 shortness of breath Pneumonia; difficult time breathing; A spontaneous report was received from a health care profession... Read more
Close
Pneumonia; difficult time breathing; A spontaneous report was received from a health care professional concerning a 40-year-old male patient who was administered Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine and experienced having a difficult time breathing (dyspnea) and pneumonia. The patient's medical history included autism and mental retardation. Concomitant product use was not provided by the reporter. On 18 Jan 2021, approximately 2 days prior to the onset of the symptoms, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Batch number not provided) for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 20 Jan 2021 early in the morning, the patient had a difficult time breathing. Around 17:00 the patient was taken to the emergency room and was given 10 liters of oxygen. The patient was admitted to the hospital. On 22 Jan 2021 everything cleared suddenly, so the patient was able to leave the hospital. The patient was diagnosed with pneumonia. The reporter indicated the patient did not have a history of lung problems, so she was concerned and wanted more information on what happened. Treatment for the event included 10 liters of oxygen. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was unknown. The outcome of the events, having a difficult time breathing and pneumonia, were considered recovered/resolved on 22 Jan 2021.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 40 year old male subject, who experienced a serious unexpected event of pneumonia after first dose of mRNA1273 (Lot# unknown). Very limited information has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.
40 2021-02-19 throat swelling Sensation of throat swelling, tingling in legs, nausea, flushing.
40 2021-02-24 shortness of breath Diffuse allergic reaction with urticaria, mild difficulty breathing the next day, right upper arm sw... Read more
Close
Diffuse allergic reaction with urticaria, mild difficulty breathing the next day, right upper arm swelling.
40 2021-02-27 shortness of breath Uncontrollable shaking; rise in blood pressure; hives; (stomach, back, face, injection site) high he... Read more
Close
Uncontrollable shaking; rise in blood pressure; hives; (stomach, back, face, injection site) high heart rate; swelling in face and neck; shortness of breath.
40 2021-03-07 throat tightness Dry mouth, dizziness and throat tightness. Benadryl 25 mg oral administered by . Pt was observed for... Read more
Close
Dry mouth, dizziness and throat tightness. Benadryl 25 mg oral administered by . Pt was observed for an additional 30 min, symptoms improved. Pt discharged home.
40 2021-03-08 throat swelling Patient states that approximately 2-3 days post-injection he began to have swelling in throat, neck,... Read more
Close
Patient states that approximately 2-3 days post-injection he began to have swelling in throat, neck, jaw, and ear on the left side of body. He states that it was severe swelling and that he had difficulty swallowing. States that he took OTC antihistamine in large doses. Rates the severity of his condition on a scale as 10/10. Approximately three days post onset, he states his condition is now 6-7/10.
40 2021-03-11 shortness of breath, throat tightness Patient received vaccine at 3:15 pm on 3/12/21 and stayed in pharmacy area for 15 min (he left feeli... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine at 3:15 pm on 3/12/21 and stayed in pharmacy area for 15 min (he left feeling fine). After about an hour 4:15 he showed back up at the pharmacy telling our pharmacy technician that he lost his voice and his throat was closing. She rushed him to the waiting room where I, pharmacist, came out and asked him what was going on. He stated he was with a client and suddenly lost his voice, and felt his throat starting to close. I asked if he was having trouble breathing and he said yes because his throat was closing and his whole arm was tingling. I had him take his mask down and try to take a few deep breaths first. I asked for permission to administer an Epi-pen which he gave verbal consent. 911 was called. Patient stated he did not want 911 called because he was going to refuse service. After a min or so patient stated his throat was back open and he was feeling good. I informed him paramedics are on their way and he needed to stay in the waiting room because effects of the EpiPen can wear off in 15 min. I stayed with him and watched until paramedics arrived. Paramedics sat with him and he did refuse service (they did take his blood pressure). When paramedics asked the patient about when he came in they asked if he was having trouble breathing and he responded "no I could breathe, my voice was just hoarse" (which is the opposite of what he told the technician and myself). He also sounded like it was very hard to breathe. I did information to the paramedics after saying that he told us his throat was closing of which they stated that they figured that was the case and they knew the patient and assumed he would refuse service. Patient was in contact with his primary care doctor who told him he could go home if his BP was ok but to make sure he had someone to drive him home. Patient had his wife come to get him and they left.
40 2021-03-11 shortness of breath Medical staff was called for patient distress. Upon getting to the car that the pt was in, he report... Read more
Close
Medical staff was called for patient distress. Upon getting to the car that the pt was in, he reported trouble focusing, left sided chest pain, and sweating. Gen: Awake, Alert, Moderate Distress, diaphoretic Cardio: RRR w/o m/g/r Resp: LCAT in all fields, mildly increased work of breathing Skin: no rashes noted, no edema noted of the face or angioedema noted of the lips Psych: anxious Neuro: able to answer questions appropriately, able to follow instructions, CN 2-12 grossly intact Pt instructed that his symptoms were not necessarily consistent with anaphylaxis but with diaphoresis and left sided CP I recommended that he be evaluated in the Emergency Department. Pt agreed to this. Transport to ED via EMS was offered and pt declined as he had a driver. Informed pt that I could not make him go via EMS but I did recommend it. Pt expressed understanding but thought that he would be fine with it being as close as it is and him being the passenger, so he again declined transport via EMS. They were instructed to proceed directly to the ED for further Eval.
40 2021-03-14 throat tightness 08MAR was given the vaccine around noon. Started to develop throat tightness and pain within the nex... Read more
Close
08MAR was given the vaccine around noon. Started to develop throat tightness and pain within the next 4 hours. Shortly thereafter developed temp 100F, chills, body aches and fatigue all which resolved within 2 days. Throat pain continued (tightness resolved) and patient then began to develop post-nasal drip and productive cough. Symptoms are continuing to today, 3/15 now 7 days post-vaccine
40 2021-03-17 shortness of breath 1 hour after shot, felt: Chest tightness Increased heart beat Felt warm in face Difficulty breathing... Read more
Close
1 hour after shot, felt: Chest tightness Increased heart beat Felt warm in face Difficulty breathing Loss of taste Lasted about 1 hour. Chest tightness and difficulty breathing were mild and intermittent. Occasional chest pain. Nothing severe just felt uncomfortable. After symptoms subsided, contacted doctor who recommended I go to urgent care to be checked out.
40 2021-03-22 mild apnea Approx1255: Patient stated he was not feeling well, light-headed. Patient pale, sweating. He asked... Read more
Close
Approx1255: Patient stated he was not feeling well, light-headed. Patient pale, sweating. He asked to lie down. Encouraged to take deep breaths. Patient asked to step outside of room, assisted to hallway chair for air. Wife at side, encouraging to take deep breaths. Patient stated he could not see us and slumped in chair with eyes open and glazed. Shallow breathing, unresponsive to sternal rub. Lips noted to turn purple-blue and then gray. Called for assistance and LVN at patient side obtaining VS, patient took deep breath and started to become responsive. VS at approx. 1303: BP104/47, HR 57, 02 Sat 95%. Patient talking, continued pale and diaphoretic. 911 called and EMS arrived at approx. 1305 Transferred to hospital.
40 2021-03-25 shortness of breath Heart racing, shortness of breath. Funny taste in my mouth so far
40 2021-04-02 wheezing, shortness of breath, asthma Fatigue during the first two days(so far). Starting to experience asthma conditions (wheezing, and s... Read more
Close
Fatigue during the first two days(so far). Starting to experience asthma conditions (wheezing, and some shortness of breath). Muscles and arm where shot was administered tender still and hurts to the touch or motion.
40 2021-04-07 shortness of breath Headache, emotional lability, body aches, difficulty breathing/shortness of breath. Headache began w... Read more
Close
Headache, emotional lability, body aches, difficulty breathing/shortness of breath. Headache began within hours of receiving vaccine. Emotional lability began the next day (4/2/21). Body aches and shortness of breath began 4/5/21.
40 2021-04-08 shortness of breath 3 days sustained fever over 102, cardiac arrest Thursday night, back & chest pain, vomiting, difficu... Read more
Close
3 days sustained fever over 102, cardiac arrest Thursday night, back & chest pain, vomiting, difficulty breathing. Went to ER, admitted to ICU, currently in ICU at hospital.
40 2021-04-12 very rapid breathing, shortness of breath uncontrollable shivering/convulsions to the point that my muscles started cramping and were sore the... Read more
Close
uncontrollable shivering/convulsions to the point that my muscles started cramping and were sore the next day difficulty breathing and hyperventilating night sweats, vomiting (1 time), confusion, body aches
40 2021-04-17 shortness of breath What a nightmare. Moderna shot #1 caused rapid hair loss and arm soreness for a week and low grade n... Read more
Close
What a nightmare. Moderna shot #1 caused rapid hair loss and arm soreness for a week and low grade nausea. But shot #2, holy moly... 12 hours post shot, I developed a fever, chills, violent shaking much of the night, weight loss, nausea, kept throwing up, massive migraine, heart rate racing, every cell in my body throbbing in pain, difficulty urinating, simply staying alive was exhausting. It faded a couple days after the shot, and in its place, fatigue, difficulty getting a full breath in. And now I have tinnitus--constant ear ringing. Absolute torture. And of course significantly more hair loss. So let's add anxiety and depression to the list because of this hell. What a regret it was to get injected with this poison. Rather just keep masking and avoiding people than be stuck with these permanent, life debilitating problems. I know it wont change anything, but I figure I'd report it anyway. What a nightmare. This crap should not be given to anyone with an autoimmune disorder.
40 2021-04-20 shortness of breath Patient received COVID vaccine intramuscular in right arm. Patient was waiting in waiting area then ... Read more
Close
Patient received COVID vaccine intramuscular in right arm. Patient was waiting in waiting area then notified the front desk 6 minutes after injection, that he was having dizziness and nausea. APA advised patient to have a seat and went to notify RN about the patients status. Registered nurse went to see about the patient. Patient was slumped in the seat with labored breathing, gagging and eyes rolled back. EMS was notified. RN removed mask, assisted patient to lean over, to allow patient to vomit in trash can. As patient continued to vomit and started regaining consciousness after about 30 seconds. Vomiting was complete. Symptoms had subsided. EMS arrived and examined patient.
40 2021-05-05 shortness of breath Intense back aches and joint aches, acute fever, shortness of breath, and exhaustion. Treatment cons... Read more
Close
Intense back aches and joint aches, acute fever, shortness of breath, and exhaustion. Treatment consisted of increased hydration, 3 rounds of 800 milligrams of ibuprofen, and many hours of sleep and rest. Symptoms persisted for 18 hours.
40 2021-05-06 wheezing, shortness of breath Symptoms: vomiting, shakes, fever, body aches, lethargy, weakness, loss of appetite, migraine, chest... Read more
Close
Symptoms: vomiting, shakes, fever, body aches, lethargy, weakness, loss of appetite, migraine, chest pains, difficulty breathing, wheezing, shortness of breath.
40 2021-05-10 shortness of breath #2 Moderna Vaccine given on 4/20/21 On 5/7/21 patient became SOB before syncope to cardiac arrest... Read more
Close
#2 Moderna Vaccine given on 4/20/21 On 5/7/21 patient became SOB before syncope to cardiac arrest, event was witnessed and CPR started immediately. Patient expired 45 min later at Medical Center.
40 2021-05-19 shortness of breath Mild SOB with moderate intensity activity, similar sensation to asthma he had when he was younger. ... Read more
Close
Mild SOB with moderate intensity activity, similar sensation to asthma he had when he was younger. No wheezing. Improved after the first week.
40 2021-05-20 shortness of breath -Dark coloring (purple&blue) around knees -Severe migraine beginning at 12:30 AM Today -Severe joi... Read more
Close
-Dark coloring (purple&blue) around knees -Severe migraine beginning at 12:30 AM Today -Severe joint pain hands & body. Can barely walk. Cannot work. -Mild shortness of breath -Mild Chills The last time I felt this type of pain I ended up in the hospital for 3-4 days with extremely high white cell blood counts. While I realize the vaccine may have side-effects, I'm also aware I have a weak immune system. So I'm taking extra precautions in the case things get worse. I'm sure I'll get better but I'd rather say something and be safe. When I get sick I tend to go down quick and I don't have any family closeby to rely on in case of an emergency. I'm completely played out on the floor hoping it will pass. Not an emergency now but it could turn the other way as it has before. Sorry for any inconveniences.
40 2021-05-22 shortness of breath Fever, chills, chest pain, shoulder pain, short breath. Recommended to see cardiologist and GI doct... Read more
Close
Fever, chills, chest pain, shoulder pain, short breath. Recommended to see cardiologist and GI doctors. Admitted into emergency hospital and found out that my lungs and hearts inflammations. it was pericarditis and treatment given for this and still on medication and still PCR report shows the inflammation high count.
40 2021-05-24 shortness of breath Pt reported five days after vaccinating started feeling shortness of breath. Symptom lasted until da... Read more
Close
Pt reported five days after vaccinating started feeling shortness of breath. Symptom lasted until day #7 post vaccination. Symptoms resolved without intervention.

Acute Liver and Kidney Injuries, severe fatigue, difficulty breathing, heart damage, body aches, etc.

Stated he felt some minor tightness on and off at throat area. No difficulty breathing.-Mild, Systemic: Nausea-Mild
40 2021-06-06 shortness of breath Chest pains (left side only), Shortness of breath, Increasing worse over 3-4 days. Went to the ER be... Read more
Close
Chest pains (left side only), Shortness of breath, Increasing worse over 3-4 days. Went to the ER because I thought I was having a heart attack.
40 2021-06-09 shortness of breath tightness, pain in chest, shortness of breath, weakness, pain and tightness in left lower neck and s... Read more
Close
tightness, pain in chest, shortness of breath, weakness, pain and tightness in left lower neck and shoulder and upper inner bicep area. Symptoms were 5-15 min duration at a time coming and going at all times of the day both with physical exertion and without. Resting pulse was around 120 with each event, symptoms came and went over the course of a week and have since subsided on their own.
40 2021-06-10 shortness of breath Chest pain and trouble breathing ending in ER visits on Jan 11 and 16, intermediate cardiologist vis... Read more
Close
Chest pain and trouble breathing ending in ER visits on Jan 11 and 16, intermediate cardiologist visit Jan 14. Significant increase in blood pressure with any exertion (160/100 after 1 flight of stairs with "one sentence" dyspnea, my baseline ~120/80, baseline weekly exercise of 4 - 8 miles running and 1+ hours strength training). Chest pain @ 2/10, some radiation to left arm. Resolved in ER with IV Toradol. Spontaneously resolved after ~2 weeks. Subsequent persistent chostocondritis, no dyspnea.
40 2021-06-10 shortness of breath Presented to ER with fever, chills, cough, shortness of breath and diarrhea. Suddenly became hypoten... Read more
Close
Presented to ER with fever, chills, cough, shortness of breath and diarrhea. Suddenly became hypotensive and diaphoretic in ER, which prompted hospital admission. Had 1/2 positive blood cultures during admission of coagulase negative staph, which was thought to be contaminant. Recieved 1 dose of IV vancomycin during stay. Required supplemental oxygen during admission and received 2 doses of dexamethasone while inpatient.
40 2021-06-15 lung pain First shot one month prior, no issues at all. Soreness at the injection site. Second shot: Next da... Read more
Close
First shot one month prior, no issues at all. Soreness at the injection site. Second shot: Next day, high fever, chills, severe muscle and joint pain. Two days after, violent vomiting. increased joint pain, fever, trouble thinking clearly. Three days after, numbness in my left hand, and loss of sensation in my entire right foot. As of 6-16, loss of feeling still continues. 1 week after, chest and lung pain, I think my heart is hurting, almost like random stabbing pains through it, random waves of muscle and joint pain. Issues sleeping. Issues with thinking clearly. I have felt run down since receiving my second shot. Loss of appetite and foggy brain.
40 2021-06-22 shortness of breath Passing out; pain; Difficulty breathing; Dizziness; Mental issues; Physical issues; Hypomanic; "Weir... Read more
Close
Passing out; pain; Difficulty breathing; Dizziness; Mental issues; Physical issues; Hypomanic; "Weird"; Weakness; pain in ankle; Gout pain; Feeling ill; Feels like he almost wants to fall asleep; Vaccination site bruising; Fatigue; headache; arm sore(left arm), muscle pain; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passing out) in a 40-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 027C21A and 053621A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included Hypoxia (Low oxygen), Mental disorder and Ankle operation. Concurrent medical conditions included Gout. On 12-May-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 09-Jun-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 12-May-2021, the patient experienced VACCINATION SITE BRUISING (Vaccination site bruising), HEADACHE (headache), MYALGIA (arm sore(left arm), muscle pain) and FATIGUE (Fatigue). On 09-Jun-2021, the patient experienced ILLNESS (Feeling ill) and SOMNOLENCE (Feels like he almost wants to fall asleep). On 13-Jun-2021, the patient experienced GOUT (Gout pain). On an unknown date, the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passing out) (seriousness criterion medically significant), PAIN (pain), DYSPNOEA (Difficulty breathing), DIZZINESS (Dizziness), MENTAL DISORDER (Mental issues), PHYSICAL DISABILITY (Physical issues), HYPOMANIA (Hypomanic), FEELING ABNORMAL ("Weird"), ASTHENIA (Weakness) and ARTHRALGIA (pain in ankle). The patient was treated with INDOMETHACIN [INDOMETACIN] for Gout, at an unspecified dose and frequency and IBUPROFEN for Gout, at an unspecified dose and frequency. At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passing out), VACCINATION SITE BRUISING (Vaccination site bruising), PAIN (pain), GOUT (Gout pain), ILLNESS (Feeling ill), DYSPNOEA (Difficulty breathing), DIZZINESS (Dizziness), MENTAL DISORDER (Mental issues), PHYSICAL DISABILITY (Physical issues), HYPOMANIA (Hypomanic), SOMNOLENCE (Feels like he almost wants to fall asleep), FEELING ABNORMAL ("Weird"), ASTHENIA (Weakness), HEADACHE (headache), MYALGIA (arm sore(left arm), muscle pain), ARTHRALGIA (pain in ankle) and FATIGUE (Fatigue) outcome was unknown. mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Unknown) dosing remained unchanged. Concomitant medications include unspecified mental health medications. Treatment information was not provided. Company comment: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. This case was linked to MOD-2021-215030 (Patient Link). Most recent FOLLOW-UP information incorporated above includes: On 14-Jun-2021: Updated new events- Mental issues, physical issues, Loss of Consciousness, Gout, Arthralgia, Hypomania and feeling abnormal. Updated patient history and treatment medications.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

41 2021-01-20 shortness of breath Started with flu like symptoms, chills, aches, etc. For about 12 hours. Then I rapidly spiked a 102.... Read more
Close
Started with flu like symptoms, chills, aches, etc. For about 12 hours. Then I rapidly spiked a 102.7 fever and became so physically weak I felt paralyzed. Oxygen saturation dropped into the low 90s and I began to have labored breathing. I made an attempt to stand up and urinate, then passed out and collapsed. Ems came to the house and checked me out. I declined their offer to go to the hospital because I broke the fever, was breathing better, and had no concussion signs from the fall.

EMS was called just to be sure that the patient was not experiencing an allergic reaction. Patient was not in distress and blood pressure was normal and could communicate fine.

Close
Pt reported throat feeling tingly and tighter ~20 minutes after vaccine, thought it was normal. Later that day, pt experienced tongue swelling and trouble breathing. Went to urgent care, got steroid treatment. Still lasted after several days. Went to the hospital, got more steroid treatment. Pt reports it is "on and off" now, 4 weeks after first dose. No history of allergic reactions to other meds/vaccines.

41 2021-03-02 shortness of breath 2 minutes after received 1st dose of Moderna COVID vaccine, patient stated unilateral headache, advi... Read more
Close
2 minutes after received 1st dose of Moderna COVID vaccine, patient stated unilateral headache, advised to drink water. 3 minutes after receiving vaccine, patient stated " I feel funny, I can't breathe" and lost consciousness x 5-10 seconds. Patient airway clear and breathing monitored. Patient regained consciousness, diaphoretic, oriented. Patient A&O x 4 after sternal rub. HR: 52, SPO2: 97% RA. Provided breath coaching, held patient in upright position, monitored breathing, had patient orally drink water. Manual B/P: 95/60, HR: 64. Patient became more coherent and stated prior to loss of consciousness he felt chest pain, denied any current chest pain, SOB, dizziness, headache, confusion, itching, rash, swelling. Consulted with MD on site who advised EMS called and to monitor patient vitals. Patient declined EMS. Patient placed in wheelchair and taken to private room to lay supine and orally drink fluids. 15 minutes later supine vitals: B/P: 117/77 HR: 68, SPO2: 99% RA. Patient rested for additional 15 minutes, sat upright for 5 minutes. Vitals sitting: B/P 117/79, HR: 69, SPO2: 99% RA. Per MD, patient approved to return home but advised not to drive. Patient stated had not eaten or been drinking water and driven 2 hours prior to vaccination. Patient stated all symptoms resolved except feeling fatigued. Advised patient's wife to drive, to eat/drink prior to leaving, if develops chest pain, SOB, facial swelling, hives, loss of consciousness, lethargy, confusion to go to ER or call 911. Patient and wife verbalized understanding. Patient monitored for 1 hour after loss of consciousness. Telephone call to patient 4 hours after vaccination. Patient stated "feeling much better," ate and drank water after leaving clinic, and resting. Patient denied SOB, chest pain, loss of consciousness, confusion, lethargy, HA, dizziness, lightheadedness. Patient advised to inform PCP of symptoms/reaction and discuss plan for when/if 2nd dose. Explained may have been vasovagal response. Patient stated several years ago having similar episode at ER when seeing blood, stated at vaccine clinic today, watched wife receive vaccine, then saw small drop of blood on his arm before loss of consciousness. Patient stated he will discuss with his PCP.

Close
blood pressure was 200/120; felt like it was hard to breathe; felt dread; felt a strange cold rush over his system; A spontaneous report was received from consumer concerning a 41 years old male patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and felt a strange cold rush over his system/ feeling cold, felt like it was hard to breathe/dyspnoea, felt dread/fear, blood pressure was 200/120/hypertension. The patient's medical history was not reported by the reporter. Concomitant medications taken by the patient were not provided. On 8 Feb 2021, prior to the onset of the event, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 013L20A) through intramuscular route at left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 8 Feb 2021, less than a minute after receiving vaccine, patient felt a strange cold rush over hissystem felt like it was hard to breathe, he felt dread. Patient reported that the facility had checked and his blood pressure was 200/120. Patient was not sure if it was a panic attack, but he took antianxiety medicine. Treatment activities for event was done with antianxiety medicine. The seriousness criteria for the event hypertension was assessed as medically significant. The seriousness criteria for other event was not reported. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was unknown. The outcome of events, and felt a strange cold rush over his system, felt like it was hard to breathe, felt dread, blood pressure was 200/120 were unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the information provided which includes a STRONG temporal association between the reported events, administration of mRNA-1273 vaccine and excluded all other etiologies, a causal association cannot be excluded

41 2021-04-12 shortness of breath 20 minutes after shot, I went from feeling fairly normal to very suddenly had very severe problems i... Read more
Close
20 minutes after shot, I went from feeling fairly normal to very suddenly had very severe problems including dizziness, confusion , significant difficulty breathing, significant difficulty staying conscious, tingling all over, loss of control of some body movements, inability to sit or stand, pulse dropped to 51 according to medic,. I believed I was dying. Medic indicated I turned "white". The symptoms peaked within 1-2 minutes after onset and stayed bad for several minutes. After a few minutes My pulse started to increase and all symptoms started improving. Within 10 minutes I was feeling well enough to sit, and within 30 minutes I was able to drive home.
41 2021-04-12 shortness of breath About 8 minutes after receiving vaccine, patient asked for water and reported that he did not feel w... Read more
Close
About 8 minutes after receiving vaccine, patient asked for water and reported that he did not feel well. He reported feeling faint and slight shortness of breath. The pharmacy staff gave him water and advised him that he could remove his mask to assist with breathing and began to observe him closely. The patient began to fee l better almost immediately, and was asked to remain in the observation area a little longer in case of worsening symptoms. During the next several minutes the patient experienced two more brief spells of faintness, which were relieved with more water and deep breathing. The patient reported that he had been working out in the sun earlier in the morning and that he was possibly a little dehydrated when he came in for his vaccine. He said that the symptoms he was experiencing were similar to episodes of dehydration he had experienced in the past. After about 40 minutes of total observation the patient said that he was feeling fine and that he felt fine to leave and drive home on his own. He walked around the store for a few minutes to make sure he would not feel faint while walking, and then left the building. I called and left a message for the patient tonight, and will attempt to call again tomorrow morning.

Patient requested transport to nearby ER at 11:52am via ALS; at 12:00pm the patient declined transport/medical care and stated he was feeling better.

41 2021-05-06 throat swelling Approximately 20min following vaccination, patient apparently experienced throat swelling and itchin... Read more
Close
Approximately 20min following vaccination, patient apparently experienced throat swelling and itching, but did not inform clinic staff of symptoms and left to return to employment. Approximately 45min later, patient returned to clinic requesting assistance for throat swelling (7/10). Patient received liquid diphenhydramine 91mg PO, throat swelling improved to (3/10). Patient was released to home and advised to seek medical treatment if symptoms did not resolve or worsened.
41 2021-05-09 shortness of breath On April 27th, I went to local ER with acute shortness of breath. X-ray and CT scan showed possible... Read more
Close
On April 27th, I went to local ER with acute shortness of breath. X-ray and CT scan showed possible fluid build up in lungs. I was admitted to hospital on April 28. Echocardiogram diagnosed heart failure, ejection fraction was 25%. Pulse was also quite high (120-135), and blood oxygen was low (88-90%). Cardiac catheterization showed no blockages in coronary arteries. Echocardiogram, EKG, and bloodwork were negative for heart attack. Ultimate diagnosis from doctor was idiopathic cardiomyopathy. Currently taking several medications and under care from primary care physician and cardiologist. At follow up appointment with primary care following discharge, she suggested I report the incident out of an abundance of caution.
41 2021-05-19 shortness of breath, painful respiration, lung pain After headaches and fatigue following the shot (within 24 hours) I began to notice slight shortness ... Read more
Close
After headaches and fatigue following the shot (within 24 hours) I began to notice slight shortness of breath 3-5 days following. I didn't give it much thought, but, roughly two weeks after my dose I began to experience severe intercostal pain and sharp pain in the lower lobe of my right lung upon inhalation. I thought this was musculoskeletal at first but after it didn't abate within days, I went to the hospital and was diagnosed with several distal pulmonary emboli. Luckily I survived and am currently on blood thinners while trying to determine the cause of this, having no history of blood clots personally or in extended family.
41 2021-05-19 shortness of breath Patient had no previous issues with vaccines in the past. Patient went to the post-vaccination chair... Read more
Close
Patient had no previous issues with vaccines in the past. Patient went to the post-vaccination chairs and about 2 minutes after giving the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine, patient's wife informed me he was not feeling well. Patient was sweating profusely, shaking, light headedness, and difficulty breathing. Site of injection looked normal. I brought him back to the immunizing booth, laid him down, gave him something soft to lay his head on and cover- up with. His sweating and shaking seemed to get worse. He wanted to sit in the chair since the floor was cold. We sat him up, gave him an ice pack, and gave him some orange juice. We called 911 and instructed EMS where to find us and the patient's symptoms. While waiting on EMS, his symptoms improved slightly. They arrived quickly and assessed the patient's blood pressure, heart rate, and blood sugar. He did not feel as if he needed to go to the hospital. I had the patient wait in the immunization booth a bit longer. He felt better, and color came back into his face. He went home with his wife. I gave them the V-Safe info, so he can report any issues while at home.
41 2021-05-20 shortness of breath, very rapid breathing Patient reported difficulty breathing, dizziness/weakness, numbness/tingling and a fast heartbeat - ... Read more
Close
Patient reported difficulty breathing, dizziness/weakness, numbness/tingling and a fast heartbeat - and suicidal ideation - went to ED. CHIEF COMPLAINT: SUICIDAL IDEATION (pt. reports suicidal thoughts) and FEVER (pt. received 2nd Moderna vaccine approx 1100 yesterday approx 3-4 hours ago developed chills/fever/anxiety/visual hallucinations/generalized body aches) HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: HPI: Patient is a 41-year-old male who presents to the emergency department from home with his wife for chief complaint of suicidal ideation, anxiety. Nursing noted him to be hyperventilating in triage. Patient states these thoughts started about 4 hours ago after he started feeling unwell. Patient states that he got his 2nd moderna COVID vaccine at 11:00 a.m. yesterday. This evening after trying to go to bed he started getting fevers body aches and myalgias. He took Advil around 8:00 p.m.. After this, he started having increased thoughts of wanting to harm himself. He states he is having "hallucinations of himself cutting his arms and legs off". He called telemedicine who told him he needs to go to the emergency department. Patient originally did not want to wake his wife up and did not want to go in but he eventually woke his wife and she brought him here. Patient does have a history of PTSD and depression. He is on Cymbalta which apparently he has been taking. He has not been able to see a counselor since the beginning of the year because of his insurance. He does see physicians through the hospital. he has never had to be inpatient but has had to come to the ER a few years ago for suicidal ideation. He also tells me that he quit his job yesterday because he doesn't like seeing people be mean to other people. ED Course as of May 19 0613 Wed May 19, 2021 0339 Patient is a 41-year-old male who presents to the emergency department with suicidal thoughts. Patient has PTSD. Suicidal thoughts started about 4 hours ago. He did get his 2nd moderna COVID vaccine at 11:00 a.m. yesterday and now has a fever and generalized body aches and fatigue. I do believe this is a normal immune response to the COVID vaccine. We will give him Toradol. Patient is very tearful and anxious. I will give him some Ativan while we are waiting for lab work to return. Medical social worker will have to evaluate the patient. 0521 MSW is currently talking to the patient. 0611 Medical social worker and wife felt that patient could be discharged home with the safety plan. He will follow up with the hospital for mental health counseling services. Patient feels much better after fever subsided. He will continue to rotate between Motrin and Tylenol. ED Course User Index DO

Close
On 5/2/2021 I woke up with severe shortness of breath. I went to a walk in clinic two times and then I ended up going to the ER two times, and I have seen my primary doctor and a pulmonologist. Through out all the visits they have done lab work, chest x-ray, CT scan, Echocardiogram. At the walk in they thought I had bronchitis so they prescribed an inhaler and another medication, later they prescribed a steroid, my first visit to the ER I was not prescribed nothing, the second time they prescribed oxygen at night and as needed, and from my pulmonologist they prescribed a different inhaled steroid.

42 2021-01-11 shortness of breath Two hours after vaccine, I had pain in the neck at my thyroid gland and what seems to be the lymph g... Read more
Close
Two hours after vaccine, I had pain in the neck at my thyroid gland and what seems to be the lymph glands behind it on the right hand side. It was tender. I took tylenol to deal with it. That pain persisted all the next day on Friday and again took tylenol and ibuprofen to deal with it. Then Saturday AM I was awaked early with severe throbbing pain in same thyroid/lymph area, it hurt to swallow, turn my head, and the pain was radiating up to my right ear. I was also having cold sweats. I managed to get the pain down again with tylenol and ibuprofen. On Sunday I spiked a temp of 100.8 and was having flu like symptoms, like body aches and more chills. I got the temp down but my heart rate remained elevated and I found it difficult to catch my breath. This went on for hours. I eventually had to go to the ER, where my pulse eventually came down. Nothing like this has ever happened before. The ER staff could not explain what had happened to me. At the time of writing this on Tuesday, 5 days after vaccine, I again had a lot of cold sweats this morning and there is still some tenderness in the lymph gland area near above the right side of my thyroid gland, but I am feeling better overall.

42 2021-01-26 shortness of breath I have existing peptic ulcer and acid reflux I have been dealing with for years. I also have elevate... Read more
Close
I have existing peptic ulcer and acid reflux I have been dealing with for years. I also have elevated cholesterol level for which I am being treated. Within 24 hours of receiving the first dose of the Moderna vaccine, the pain from my peptic ulcer went from 2 to 10 on a scale of 10. It became so severe that I could not sit at work. I had to leave work and went back home. Then on January 13, 2021, I started noticing a back pain that radiates throughout my left back side. On January 15, 2021, I went to the ER because the pain was so severe that I could not not lie down, sit, or breath. I was diagnosed with pleurisy (inflammation of the lung linings). The X-ray also showed enlarged heart but the ER doctor said my heart is fine. They also performed EKG on me. I did not mention receiving the vaccine to the ER doctor because I never thought the vaccine could result in such side effects. I did not mention it to my PCP also because I believe the vaccine is safe. But recently I went through the sequence of events myself and the only thing that happened regarding my health was the vaccine. Nothing else. After vaccination, I went to ER on Jan 15, 2021 at around 11:30PM due to severe back pain and was diagnosed with pleurisy through X-ray. My X-ray also showed an enlarged heart but I suspect that was due to the fact that I could not breath properly when the x-ray was taken. I will repeat the X-ray in a couple of weeks. Never experienced pleurisy or heart enlargement in my life prior to the vaccine. Not sure the vaccine was responsible but the coincidence is suspicious.
42 2021-01-28 throat tightness Approximately 15" after receiving vaccine, patient stated his 'throat started to feel tight, tongue ... Read more
Close
Approximately 15" after receiving vaccine, patient stated his 'throat started to feel tight, tongue felt swollen and face and head itchy". Medical staff administered Benadryl, took VS and stayed with patient. Voice is very hoarse. Medical provider in with patient and did a physical assessment. At 30" patient stated his tongue remained swollen, more Benadryl given. Medical staff remains with patient. After about 60 minutes from time of administration of vaccine he drove himself home. Rested all afternoon, did take Tylenol. Stated he had a restless night, not much sleep, very achy, tongue and throat better.

~ 1 -2 second patient stated that he was feeling heat in his arm; face noted to flushed ~30 seconds continue to have burning ~ 1 min moved to Isolation; c/o metallic taste in mouth and feels nausea ~ patient appears the same - allergic symptoms reviewed multiple times 1514 162/102 112; c/o tongue thickness ~1516 stated he felt mild tightness to in throat ~ 1518 136/96 100; states he is feeling worse; EPI pen suggested patient declined ~1520 paten states his allergist had told him that he is not a candidate for the Moderna Vaccine ~ 1524 EMT was called given patients condition and the allergist suggested no vaccinations ~1524 patient continues to refuse EPI administration despite c/o throat tightness and enlarged tongue; able swallow and tongue visually appears normal 1528 131/81 100 99%; stated tightness is improving 1530 158/106 104 flushed able to swallow; lung sound are clear; no increased WOB 1533 EMT at bedside - care endorsed to EMT after rport given As he was leaving with EMT patient stated he may have had COVID 19 ~ December 12 to 20 2019
42 2021-02-22 shortness of breath Difficulty breathing; Allergic reaction; Pain in the arm that radiated up to the neck; Hot and cold ... Read more
Close
Difficulty breathing; Allergic reaction; Pain in the arm that radiated up to the neck; Hot and cold flashes; Hot and cold flashes; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer, who was also a 43-year-old male patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced an allergic reaction, hot and cold flashes, difficulty breathing and pain in the arm that radiated up to the neck. The patient's medical history, as provided by the reporter, included asthma and allergies. Concomitant medications were not reported. On 15 Jan 2021, prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (lot number: 026L20A; expiration date: 28 Jul 2021) intramuscularly in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 15 Jan 2021, four hours after vaccination, the patient experienced hot and cold flashes and pain in his arm that radiated up to his neck. He had some food and went to bed. The next day, on 16 Jan 2021, the patient had an "adverse reaction, allergic reaction". This event was considered to be medically significant. treatments at home but had no relief. The patient still had trouble breathing so he went to the emergency room as his physician told him to. He was given three more nebulizers of ipratropium bromide (+) albuterol sulfate, steroids, diphenhydramine hydrochloride, and famotidine but he still had trouble breathing. Therefore, the patient was admitted into the hospital for observation. The patient was discharged on 17 Jan 2021 with two to three bags of normal saline and four bags of "lactose ringers". In addition, his physician put him on a steroid and inhaler. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events were not reported. The outcomes of the events, allergic reaction, difficulty breathing, hot and cold flashes, and pain in the arm that radiated up to the neck, were unknown at the time of this report.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the onset date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Of note, patient's significant medical history included asthma and allergies.
42 2021-03-01 throat tightness On the first day I had a huge lump underneath my armpit I did not become too concerned with that I r... Read more
Close
On the first day I had a huge lump underneath my armpit I did not become too concerned with that I read it was something that could happen regarding the lymph node. 10 days later I woke up at 3:30 in the morning and had to dial 911 my throat felt like it was closing and my lips were both swollen. I went in the ambulance they brought me to the emergency room where they gave me Benadryl a steroid and some IV fluids. as soon as I receive the Benadryl my throat started to open up and my lips both started to go down . My lip continue to swell for the next three days on and off often on. Every time it swelled up I took Benadryl and every time sure enough it went away . The day I came home from the hospital I thought I was doing much better until that following night I became severely nauseous. I don?t know if it was something that they had given me in the hospital or still a reaction that was going on in my body, but I had some sort of stomach bug I threw up that whole day, had chills sweats and a pounding headache that would not go away for over 48 hours .I was unable to eat or drink for 24 hours and had to go to an urgent care where they provided me with some medication for nausea. My concern right now is I am hearing that the second shot hits a lot harder than the first one and if this was a reaction to the shot I am very afraid of what will go on if I get the second one. I cannot take a chance with my life. I really want to shot I work in an environment where I am working with the department which is why I was able to get the vaccine so early I feel safe being vaccinated I am very disappointed that this happened I just cannot take a chance having a family etc. Also I have very bad medical in Sherance so I am dealing with all of the bills from this hospital stay I have a deductible which I can?t afford and then only 50% is covered afterwards. That is the reason I do not go to the hospital under no circumstance unless I am dying which that night I was that scared I felt the need I had to go.

Within 24 hours I spiked a 101.2 fever and begin having digestive issues. Gas, bloating, and diarrhea. I was weak and had no energy for 5-6 days. Since my second dose I experience almost daily bouts of generalized weakness, dizziness, and shortness of breath.

Fever up to 103.2. Fever over 24 hours. Severe nausea and vomiting. Shortness of breath. Diarrhea, fatigue, extreme muscle pain and some joint pain. Confusion at height of fever. Fever is 100.7 at 32 hours after injection. Treating with Tylenol.
42 2021-04-19 shortness of breath Symptoms started around a week after COVID-19 vaccine, when patient started having shortness of brea... Read more
Close
Symptoms started around a week after COVID-19 vaccine, when patient started having shortness of breath cough and nasal congestion. He was having yellow sputum production and he had chills. Upon arrival to the hospital on 4/18 the patient was tachycardic and chest x-ray that showed cardiomegaly with fluid overload. Progressively became severely hypoxemic and had to be emergently intubated and placed on mechanical ventilation. Patient developed cardiogenic shock which may be acute myocarditis and was placed on an Impella device and norepinephrine drip. The patient continued to worsen and developed acute kidney injury and hyperkalemia and was placed on CRRT. LFTs were also elevated. Patient also went into atrial fibrillation and was started on amiodarone drip. All of the above mentioned occurred within a 12 hour period.
42 2021-04-20 lung infiltration This is a 42-year-old male patient with past medical history of hypertension presented to the emerge... Read more
Close
This is a 42-year-old male patient with past medical history of hypertension presented to the emergency department today with complaints of nausea, vomiting, diarrhea over the last 5 days. Patient also noted having a nonproductive cough. Denies any fever, chills, chest pain, shortness of breath. Patient notes he got his 2nd CoVID vaccination on the 9th. Imaging done in the emergency department showed Left midlung infiltrates and probably also in the middle lobe. Patient's labs sodium 136, potassium 4.2, BUN 21, creatinine 2.87, glucose 154. Patient was started on IV antibiotics in the emergency department.

42 2021-04-25 shortness of breath On 4/22/21, approximately 1 hr after the Moderna COVID-19 first vaccination injection, I started to ... Read more
Close
On 4/22/21, approximately 1 hr after the Moderna COVID-19 first vaccination injection, I started to encounter allergic reactions that I used to suffer about 20 years ago. My air intake decreased, and my skin began to become irritated. I formerly had environmental allergies that would reduce my air intake, and the first place I noticed the effects were on my skin and I would become irritable. Physicians told me that when my oxygen levels were low, the body would channel the air to where it was most needed, which is generally not the skin, so my skin would become irritated. When this used to occur, I would respond involuntarily with facial twitches and pulling at my face and hair. Physicians explained that these twitches and pulling actions would draw air to the surface of my skin where I was air depleted. When I took the Moderna injection, this happened again -- I found myself with low air, my face was twitching, and I was pulling on my face to draw air to the area. The result when I was 19 and dealing with allergies is that I would remove small patches of hair from my head or eyebrows or eyelashes, and this would happen almost unconsciously as I tried to stimulate the areas and draw air to the surface of my skin. I did the same thing on 4/22/21, and found later, when looking into a mirror, that I had removed a section of my eyebrow unconsciously. It all comes back to oxygen depletion. A different and more intense event occurred in the night of Friday, 4/23/21, and the early morning of Saturday, 4/24/21. I went to bed at about 11 p.m. or 11:30 p.m. Between that time and approximately 1:30 a.m., I had difficulty sleeping, and I dreamed of pain in my chest. I finally woke up about 1:30 a.m. and found the pain in my chest was real. I was having difficulty breathing deeply. It felt as if the lower part of my lungs (at least on one side) was solidifying or inaccessible. What I did was begin forcing myself to breathe as deeply as possible. Over a period of 30 minutes or longer, I was able to gradually reclaim the use of the deepest part of my longs. With every forced deep breath, I was able to chip away at the area that felt like it was freezing up. Finally, I felt that I could access the deepest part of my longs and breath normally. The pain and lack of use in my lower lungs were very concerning.
42 2021-04-26 shortness of breath Per Patient report: Headache started within 1 hour of vaccination. the following day, Blood sugar ... Read more
Close
Per Patient report: Headache started within 1 hour of vaccination. the following day, Blood sugar and Blood Pressure rose to dangerous levels. Nausea and vomiting. Blood pressure 2??/185, Blood sugar so high unreadable >600?; Unresponsive, breathing labored O2 Stat was low and on oxygen, went by EMS to Medical Center. At ER Blood pressure and HR decreased to dangerous levels for approximately 6 hours. Patient stayed in the hospital for 7 days while he was monitored for continued changes in blood sugar and blood pressure as well as severe nausea and vomiting.

42 2021-05-09 shortness of breath Patient received his first dose of COVID vaccine on 4/24/21. Around 4/30/21 (~ 1 week prior to admi... Read more
Close
Patient received his first dose of COVID vaccine on 4/24/21. Around 4/30/21 (~ 1 week prior to admission), pt developed cough, runny nose, lack of appetite, loss of smell, and shortness of breath. Pt's symptoms became progressively worse, and he presented to the ED on 5/7/21, where he tested positive for COVID. Pt was found to be hypoxic (89% SpO2) and was started on supplemental O2. He was also admitted to the hospital for COVID treatment .
42 2021-05-10 shortness of breath Within 12 hours I started running fever, having trouble breathing, and a cough that would not stop. ... Read more
Close
Within 12 hours I started running fever, having trouble breathing, and a cough that would not stop. These symptoms continued to worsen over the next 48 hours. It got to the point that the only way I could breath and grasp air was laying down on my side. I went to the ER and was admitted within hours. They had to put me in a medicated coma and deep lung intubate both lungs. I had internal bleeding which the doctors could not explain. They tested me for everything across the medical spectrum looking for some underlying health issue and found none. Several of the doctors said there is no explanation other than I had an extreme adverse reaction to the vaccine.
42 2021-05-10 shortness of breath Patient received his second Moderna shot at approximately 11:45am. He waited for 15 minutes at the ... Read more
Close
Patient received his second Moderna shot at approximately 11:45am. He waited for 15 minutes at the pharmacy, then went shopping. He later came back around 12:20 and said he felt a little short of breath. He did not appear to be in distress and was talking normally. I had him sit down and remove his mask. I got him some cold water and his sister asked him if he was just nervous. He replied no. She said he had heart issues and that she was going to take him to the urgent care to just make sure he was ok. He was able to walk and talk normally and did not appear to be in distress. I called him later to check on him and he said the urgent care said it was probably an allergic reaction and they gave him prednisone and benadryl and he felt fine now.

42 2021-06-01 shortness of breath Patient experienced facial numness/tingling, chest tightness, possible throat swelling, and shortne... Read more
Close
Patient experienced facial numness/tingling, chest tightness, possible throat swelling, and shortness of breath about 10 minutes after administering Moderna Covid vaccine dose 1. Instructed patient to stay in consultation room for observation. I stayed with the patient and called 911. EMS arrived on scene about 5-10 minutes later. Took vitals, oxygen saturation within normal limits, elevated bp, normal heart rate. EMS monitored patient for about 15 minutes after which patient was still conscious and alert. EMS advised patient to go to hospital for further evaluation and patient accepted. EMS took patient to hospital. Patient generally seemed fine when he left the pharmacy which was about 30 minutes after receiving the vaccine.

43 2021-01-05 shortness of breath, throat tightness about 10-15 minutes after injection, felt tightness in throat and sore throat with a little difficul... Read more
Close
about 10-15 minutes after injection, felt tightness in throat and sore throat with a little difficulty breathing. Notified onsite RN who immediately gave him 50mg oral Benadryl. Vitals done by EMT onsite, BP `164/108, P=110, slightly swollen tongue. Did not have Pulse Oximeter until 30m after reaction. At that time, O2=94%. 15m after Benadryl patient stated he felt 80% better. 45m after Benadryl patient felt 95% better, BP = 134/96, P= 64, O2=98% and no tongue swelling. Patient wife will pick him up and drive him home. Instructed to take 50mg in 4 hours and call 911 if any symptoms return.

Close
On 12/24, at 8:30a I began to get nauseated which lasted about 2hrs. Around 1am I woke up with SOB which continued thru the night, with off and on sleep. I woke back up at 5:45am, went to work with the SOB which lasted until 12N and resolved on its own. Around 3-330pm I began to feel feverish and had chills and was told I was disoriented. My temp was 100.5, HR 122 R 34 BP 170/100 O2-93%. I notified the DON of my feelings who advised me those were possible side effects of the vaccine and made me continue to work until I just couldnt take the feelings anymore and went to the ER. I was there for about 2 hrs and my body began to calm down. I took taken 100mg of Tylenol on my own just to help with the fever which did break shortly and I have been fine every since. I was positive for COVID 12/14.

43 2021-02-14 shortness of breath Baseball sized diameter swelling around injection site, red (like a rash) in color, itchy, painful t... Read more
Close
Baseball sized diameter swelling around injection site, red (like a rash) in color, itchy, painful to touch and warm to touch. Rash looked yellow to black and blue around the edges as it progressed down the arm. Over the course of 5 days spread from injection site, around the elbow and into the forearm. Hip, knee, foot, shoulder and elbow pain on left side only, Body aches, nausea, visual impairment and loss of balance. Difficulty concentrating and relative "brain fog". Severe drowsiness in the sense of falling asleep while talking to someone and then no memory of it. Chest pressure and constant feeling of being out of breath. Cannot catch breath walking across the house from one room to the next. Severity of symptoms subsided within 24 hours, but some linger up to the time of this report. They are shortness of breath, rash with warmth and pain, lack of concentration and brain fog. Elbow still tender to touch.

43 2021-03-23 shortness of breath At 16:05 this RN was called to evaluate a patient with a reaction after receiving his first dose of ... Read more
Close
At 16:05 this RN was called to evaluate a patient with a reaction after receiving his first dose of the covid shot. He stated that he had shortness of breath for 1-2 minutes and then Slight dizziness and tingling throughout his body that came and went every 4-5 minutes. Patient was brought to the nurse clinic for observation. I observed patient for 30 + minutes as his symptoms subsided and he returned to his baseline. See vital signs below. At 16:45, patient denied any further symptoms and stated he felt better. Dr. was called with a brief report of these findings and advised that patient was ok to leave and to follow up or to go to Urgent Care if symptoms return or become worse. Patient was provided with these instructions. He verbalized an understanding of information provided him. Patient left ambulatory with no distress noted.
43 2021-03-31 wheezing 43 y/o man with significant for asthma developed lightheadedness and the sensation of an object in t... Read more
Close
43 y/o man with significant for asthma developed lightheadedness and the sensation of an object in the back of his throat with swallowing about five minutes after getting his vaccine. He denied difficulty breathing. His initial vitals were 160/100, HR 100, O2 saturations 96%. On examination, his tongue was not swollen and he had faint expiratory wheezing. He was given 12.5mg of liquid benadryl. He reported his symptoms slightly improved after five minutes of liquid benadryl. His vitals were measured again about 20 minutes after his first set of vitals and his vitals were 150/100, HR 105, O2 sats 95%. He was given a second dose of 12.5mg of liquid benadryl. After another 20 minutes, he reported that his symptoms were much improved. On examination, his tongue was not swollen and faint expiratory wheezing was heard. Last set of vitals were 140/95, HR 95, and O2 saturations 96%. He calm and relaxed and was released. He was told that he would not get his second dose with the current team due to the location being a non-clinical setting. He was told to follow up with his PCM and/or allergist regarding if he should get a second dose in a hospital setting.

Close
Patient complained of dizziness about 15 minutes after vaccine was administered. After another 5 minutes symptoms progressed to include shortness of breath and chest pains. Was sent to the Emergency Room immediately.
43 2021-04-04 shortness of breath On my first dose vaccine, 01-22-2021, I went to bed at 9:00pm. On 01-23-2021 in the next morning I ... Read more
Close
On my first dose vaccine, 01-22-2021, I went to bed at 9:00pm. On 01-23-2021 in the next morning I woke up with heart racing with chest pressure, felt dizzy with SOB. I called an ambulance and they performed an EKG which was normal. I went to the hospital and they did triponine values, EKG and I was released after 24 hours of monitoring. About five days later I went to see my PCP for a physical I had scheduled. He performed another EKG and this time it looked abnormal, showed I had gone into cardiac arrest and other tests, such as stress test, reactive blockages test and heart test were also performed. I had no blockage nor heart attack. I then drove home and since then I have been going to doctor's appointments. I have also scheduled a second dose of Moderna vaccine in three to four weeks.

throat started feeling tight; Throat was swollen; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of THROAT TIGHTNESS (throat started feeling tight) and PHARYNGEAL SWELLING (Throat was swollen) in a 43-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. Concurrent medical conditions included Seasonal allergy, Allergy to animal and Allergy to chemicals (possible polyethylene glycol allergy). On 07-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 07-Apr-2021, the patient experienced THROAT TIGHTNESS (throat started feeling tight) (seriousness criterion life threatening) and PHARYNGEAL SWELLING (Throat was swollen) (seriousness criterion life threatening). At the time of the report, THROAT TIGHTNESS (throat started feeling tight) and PHARYNGEAL SWELLING (Throat was swollen) had resolved. Not Provided The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. Concomitant medications were not reported. Treatment medication was not provided. Based on the current available information which includes a temporal association between the use of mRNA-1273 vaccine and onset of the reported events, causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information which includes a temporal association between the use of mRNA-1273 vaccine and onset of the reported events, causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Patient reported fevers, chills and myalgia after 1st dose of Moderna COVID vaccine 4/22. Poor PO intake and had syncopal episode on 4/24 when standing from the recliner. Initially admitted at hospital, and developed fever, leukocytosis, AKI. Transferred to other hospital for further evaluation and eventually developed acute hypoxic respiratory failure requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation, found to have new onsert heart failure with reduced ejection fraction. He is currently being evaluated for auto-immune and underlying infectious causes, with concern for glumerunephritis, cardiomyopathy and coronary artery disease. Patient extubated to NC as of today but remains in the ICU.

Close
covid-19 infection; SOB; Cough; Bilateral lung infiltrate; Fever; vaccination failure; This case was received via an unknown source (no reference has been entered for a health authority or license partner) on 27-Apr-2021 and was forwarded to Moderna on 27-Apr-2021. This case describes the occurrence of COVID-19 (covid-19 infection), DYSPNOEA (SOB), COUGH (Cough), LUNG INFILTRATION (Bilateral lung infiltrate) and PYREXIA (Fever) in a 43-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. Concurrent medical conditions included Kidney transplant (11.35 years from transplant), Pancreatic transplant (11.35 years from transplant) and Diabetes mellitus (Cause for organ transplants). Concomitant products included BELATACEPT, MYCOPHENOLATE MOFETIL and PREDNISONE for Immunosuppression. On an unknown date, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On an unknown date, the patient experienced COVID-19 (covid-19 infection) (seriousness criterion hospitalization prolonged), DYSPNOEA (SOB) (seriousness criterion hospitalization prolonged), COUGH (Cough) (seriousness criterion hospitalization prolonged), LUNG INFILTRATION (Bilateral lung infiltrate) (seriousness criterion hospitalization prolonged), PYREXIA (Fever) (seriousness criterion hospitalization prolonged) and VACCINATION FAILURE (vaccination failure). The patient was hospitalized for 11 days due to COUGH, COVID-19, DYSPNOEA, LUNG INFILTRATION and PYREXIA. At the time of the report, COVID-19 (covid-19 infection), DYSPNOEA (SOB), COUGH (Cough), LUNG INFILTRATION (Bilateral lung infiltrate), PYREXIA (Fever) and VACCINATION FAILURE (vaccination failure) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On an unknown date, Blood creatinine: >0.3mg/ml (abnormal) >0.3mg/ml. On an unknown date, Lymphopenia: <900/mcl (abnormal) <900/mcL. On an unknown date, Oxygen saturation: <92% (abnormal) Hypoxia. On an unknown date, SARS-CoV-2 antibody test: negative (Negative) Negative. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Patients were comparable to those of solid organ transplant patients (SOTs) who had COVID-19 infection and have not been vaccinated. Antinucleocapside antibody at COVID-19 diagnosis was also negative. Treatment for COVID-19 was with Bamlanivimab (MAB1), Remdesivir, Dexamethasone, Convalescent Plasma and Tocilizumab. Patient's concomitant medication Mycophenolate Mofetil (immunosuppression therapy) was withheld during hospitalization. Patient was discharge on 2 liters of oxygen. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. However the patient's concurrent medical conditions of Kidney transplant, Pancreatic transplant, Diabetes mellitus and use of immunosuppressants remains a risk factor. Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. However the patient's concurrent medical conditions of Kidney transplant, Pancreatic transplant, Diabetes mellitus and use of immunosuppressants remains a risk factor.

43 2021-06-08 shortness of breath ANAPHYLAXIS: Pt received his second Moderna COVID19 shot on 12Apr2021 at approximately 2:30pm. He wa... Read more
Close
ANAPHYLAXIS: Pt received his second Moderna COVID19 shot on 12Apr2021 at approximately 2:30pm. He waited the required 20 minutes to check for any adverse reaction and then left the facility to drive home. On his drive home, at approximately 3:30pm, he started feeling light headed and lost consciousness, striking a telephone pole. He was gasping and struggling to breathe, so the ambulance treated him with oxygen. When he arrived at the ER , the doctor assessed his condition and confirmed that he was experiencing an anaphylactic reaction related to the COVID vaccine and treated him with an epinephrine injection, steroids, benadryl, and nebulized albuterol.to open his airways. He remained at the ER for ~ 6 hours for observation until his blood oxygen levels increased and he was stable to be released. The car accident resulted in PT suffering a fractured sternum as confirmed via Chest CT Scan by his primary doctor. PT has no history of any allergic reaction to any medication or vaccine. Although he does have well-regulated asthma, this incident was not characteristic of any asthma-related reaction he has ever experienced.

Close
Felt lethargic (aprox. 1 hour after shot) went home fell asleep for about 2 hours and woke up severe pain in chest and tightening of chest and airway and could only get about half at most of a full breath of air every breath. Could only get sufficient O2 it seemed when lying on back and laying down on my side. Was every bit of all my energy to just take a shower and nearly blacked out with heart racing as I tried to breath in the shower but steam in air was too much to breathe. Lasted for 4 days that way. I still feel like I am constantly winded and I as of today have only regained about half the lung capacity I had prior to incident, and that is just over 1 month mark. I also now have been getting these bad facial breakouts particularly on and around my nose and forehead /;eyes area. I never ever had any acne issues to speak of prior, even as a teen and during puberty. Never had any acne ever and now its bad breakouts some appear to may even leave ling term scarring in certain spots. My day to day diet and normal habits have not been added to or altered in any way either. My heart feels like it beats twice as fast and twice as hard now and I am always short of breath now too. I do not have a family doctor to go and see and I was afraid to call for an e.m.t. or go to the e.r. at the early onset of it all. I truly hought I was a gonner a couple of times though throughout the first 4 days.

Near vasovagal syncope 5 days after 2nd dose. 5 days after my second COVID vaccine, I was outside in snowy, cold weather about a mile from my car. I had stopped moving to rearrange some items. While stopped, I started to feel lightheaded, develop tunnel vision, and feel faint, almost to the point of blacking out. I put my head down and legs up and felt somewhat better. I then attempted to return to my car. I could go 100-200 yards at a stretch, before having to purposefully fall down and elevate my legs. I traveled the mile back to my car like this (slowly). I could not check my pulse because my hands were too cold; my respiration rate was elevated. At the car, I drank fluids and warmed up and began to recover enough to get home.

S/S did not resolve so another 0.3 mg of epinephrine was administered IM LVG. EMS was called and patient refused transport to hospital. S/S resolved.

Diagnosed with cellulitis; Diagnosed with sepsis; Temperature 102 degrees F/104 degrees F; Chills/Shivering; Discomfort; Difficulty breathing; Felt cold; Not feeling good; In a lot of pain; A spontaneous report was received from a pharmacist concerning a 44-year-old, male patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and developed cellulitis, sepsis, temperature was 102 and 104 degrees F/fever, dyspnoea/difficulty breathing, feeling cold, malaise/unwell, pain, discomfort and chills. The patient's medical history was not provided. Products known to have been used by the patient, within two weeks prior to the event were not reported. On 11 Mar 2021, the patient consulted wound care for his foot and was told to be fine. On 13 Mar 2021, prior to the onset of the symptoms, the patient received their dose of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (batch number: unknown) for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 13 Mar 2021, within eight to ten minutes, after vaccination patient felt cold .The patient's temperature was noted to be 102 degree Fahrenheit. Also, patient reported a lot of pain and discomfort. Patient also complained about chills, cold and shivering and he was given an orange juice and blanket after five to ten minutes by the pharmacist. Pharmacist called patients wife and by that time patient developed breathing difficulty. Patient's temperature was raised to 104-degree Fahrenheit by that time and was taken by the emergency medical service to the hospital. The patient was hospitalised. On 16 Mar 2021, after 2 days, patients wife reported to pharmacist that the patient was diagnosed with sepsis and cellulitis and was given two antibiotics. The events sepsis and cellulitis were considered as serious (medically significant). The patient's wife reported that the patient was about to have an amputation in this past weekend. Treatment for the event included two unknown antibiotics. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the event was unknown. The outcome of the events cellulitis, sepsis, temperature was 102 and 104 degrees F/fever, dyspnea /difficulty breathing, feeling cold, malaise/unwell, pain, discomfort and chills were considered to be unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.
