Evaluation was positive for bilateral DVT and pulmonary embolism Bilateral PE, infarction, bilateral DVTs -No obvious precipitating factors -patient underwent first COVID 19 vaccine injection, is actually due for second shot. Unclear if this is contributed, recommended to hold on getting second dose and discuss this with PCP. -Also follow-up with PCP for appropriate cancer screening -patient was treated with therapeutic subcutaneous Lovenox, remained hemodynamically stable and is feeling better today. Upon discharge we'll prescribe Elocon is 10 mg b.i.d. for another 5 days followed by 5 mg b.i.d. maintenance dose. He will be provided with coupon for 1 month supply, he was recommended to follow-up with PCP for further recommendations. He will probably need anticoagulation for at least 6 months or longer depending on further course. -Echocardiogram showed ejection fraction 50-55%, Mild mitral valve prolapse no evidence of RV strain. Hemoptysis -Most likely was related to PE and infarction -resolved. Pleuritic chest pain, h/o Afib -Most likely pain was secondary to PE, improved -Continue Cardizem as prior to admission -Stop aspirin since patient will be on anticoagulation therapy History of opioid dependence, alcohol abuse Continue suboxone Ongoing smoking smoking cessation was advised Disposition: Routine Discharge Home CONSULTS: Consults Ordered during this Encounter Procedures ? Ancillary Service Request - IV Team New IV Start (multiple sticks for labs) ? Ancillary Service Request - Social Services PROCEDURES: Procedures Ordered during this Encounter Procedures ? Patient is currently on therapeutic anticoagulation (warfarin, Pradaxa, IV heparin, Rivaroxaban) - no reassessment RADIOLOGY TESTS: CT CTA Chest Final Result 1. Segmental and subsegmental pulmonary emboli throughout the right lung, most prominent in the right lower lobe. Segmental and subsegmental pulmonary artery the left pleural effusion. 2. Wedge-shaped opacities at both lung bases concerning for small pulmonary infarcts. 3. No findings of right heart strain or pulmonary hypertension. Impression discussed with Dr of the ER at 20:44 on 03/24/2021 by phone. Electronically signed by: MD 3/24/2021 8:46 PM US Legs Bil Venous DVT Final Result Bilateral posterior tibial vein thrombosis. This critical result was called to the clinical team, including by telephone, at 6:00 PM by the sonographer, according to internal Department documentation. Electronically signed by: MD 3/24/2021 6:16 PM XR Chest PA and Lateral Final Result Small bilateral pleural effusions. Streaky left basilar opacity may reflect atelectasis or infiltrate. Small right basilar opacity of uncertain significance. All opacities are new since 2016. No pneumothorax. 4 week follow-up is recommended. If the abnormalities have not resolved by then, chest CT is recommended. PT'S DAUGHTER CALLED ON THE MORNING OF 04/19/2021 AND SAID SHE WAS CONCERNED ABOUT HER DAD AS HE HAD BEEN COMPLAINING OF A "VERY BAD FEVER, HEADACHE AND CHEST PAIN." PT'S DAUGHTER WAS ASKED IF HER DAD HAD TROUBLE BREATHING AND SHE SAID YES. WHEN ASKED ABOUT HOW LONG IT HAD BEEN GOING ON, SHE SAID SINCE LAST NIGHT. SHE ALSO SAID THE FEVER HAD REACHED 102 DEGREES. PT'S DAUGHTER SAID HER DAD HAD NOT TRIED TAKING ANYTHING TO HELP TREAT THE FEVER OR HEADACHE. SHE ASKED ABOUT IF SHE SHOULD HAVE HIM TAKE TYLENOL, BUT DUE TO THE COMPLAINT OF "SEVERE CHEST PAIN" AND "DIFFICULTY BREATHING," IT WAS RECOMMENDED THE PT SEEK IMMEDIATE MEDICAL ATTENTION AND GO TO THE ER. Patient received his first dose of COVID vaccine on 4/8 and developed GI symptoms ~ 4/16. Patient tested positive for COVID on 4/25 when he presented to the ED. However, he was sent home at that time since he was stable to go home and was not hypoxic. Pt presented to the ED again on 5/4 due to dyspnea on exertion and pain in the back of his knee. Patient was found to be positive for DVT and PE and was started on therapeutic Lovenox. Patient doesn't have a history of VTE, but he does have a family history of VTE. Since patient wasn't found to be hypoxic, COVID treatment wasn't started in the hospital.

Close
Received vaccine at medical center. 5 minutes after initial vaccination felt dizzy. After a few minutes he was feeling better so left for car at 15 minutes post vaccination. Once getting to car developed lightheadedness, tachycardia, shortness of breath. Brought back into facility given IM epi 0.3 mg with improvement and send via ambulance to our emergency department. No urticarial lesions or angioedema. Observed for approximately 2 hours. No recurrence. Discharged home. No additional meds after epi given in the field.
44 2021-05-18 painful respiration Around 10am I was feeling a bit hungry and my stomach seemed 'sore'. I air fried some chicken for m... Read more
Close
Around 10am I was feeling a bit hungry and my stomach seemed 'sore'. I air fried some chicken for myself, but still felt hungry. I was feeling rather irritable, and an hour or two later I was violently vomiting. I tried to drink some water shortly after, and that did not help. My stomach was still rather upset and I vomited again an hour later. I laid down on the couch the rest of the day with my stomach feeling rather upset in way I've not really experienced before. I was able to sleep for a few hours and I was able to drink small amounts of water by midnight. I felt a bit cold but I don't remember anyone saying I had a fever. I was irritable, deep breaths kinda hurt, and I was a tad dizzy most of the day. I was able to eat and drink the next morning, but my abdomen was sore. It still is a bit sore, but I feel almost 100%.

44 2021-05-26 respiratory rate increased 5/1/21: Patient woke with chest pain, elevated respiratory rate, nausea, and sweating. Recognizing ... Read more
Close
5/1/21: Patient woke with chest pain, elevated respiratory rate, nausea, and sweating. Recognizing symptoms of a heart attack, the patient presented to the emergency room at 5:30am. ECG normal, Troponin at 2.1 at presentation, continued to increase to 4.6 prior to being taken to Cath Lab. Coronary angiography showed no occlusion; patient admitted to telemetry unit for continued monitoring; discharged following day with order for cardiac MRI. Outpatient cardiac MRI conducted 5/5/21 revealed myocarditis. Treatment with beta blockers (Metopolol Succinate 25MG QID) and anti-inflamatory (indomethacin 25MG TID) with direction to avoid exercise. Light yardwork on 5/22 resulted in patient feeling "racing heart".

44 2021-05-30 shortness of breath Initially, the patient had dizziness, lightheadedness and a syncopal episode within 5 minutes of the... Read more
Close
Initially, the patient had dizziness, lightheadedness and a syncopal episode within 5 minutes of the vaccine. He returned to normal fairly quickly and went home by report. He presented to the ER shortly after with palpitations and shortness of breath and required a dose of IM epinephrine. Patient since had intermittent fatigue, dizziness, blurred and vision changes as well as tinnitus. On May 31, 2021, patient presented to the ER with headache, lethargy, weakness, diaphoresis and dizziness. Additionally, noted to have slurred speech by his wife. MRI of the brain done at 4 am on 5/31/21 showed the following "1. Acute bilateral cerebellar infarcts are seen with a right posterior 4.3 mm focus a left middle cerebellar peduncle 3.2 mm focus and a left superior cerebellar 7.9 mm linear focus. 2. Occlusion of the left vertebral artery extending into the basilar artery with reconstitution of the basilar artery via bilateral posterior communicating arteries. Findings are concerning for acute dissection occlusion. Consider further evaluation with MRA head and neck. 3. Question subtle area of restricted diffusion seen within the left dorsal medulla better appreciated on the maps measuring approximately 4.9 mm. Left lateral pontine 7.3 mm focus of restricted diffusion versus artifact. These infarcts are not definite and could be artifactual asymmetry.'. He required admission, heparin drip and neurology consult at that time, as well as permissive hypertension. shortly after 1 pm on May 31, he developed chest pain with ischemic changes on EKG requiring cardiology consult with possible intervention, though this was being coordinated with interventional neurology, as he also required basilar angiogram for his MRI findings. as cardiology and interventional neurology were coordinating taking patient for intervention, he became further unresponsive, though maintained his pulse, and required intubation and transfer to ICU, as well as repeat CT of the head to evaluate for continued thrombosis of his basilar system. Work up is still on going
44 2021-06-02 fluid in lungs, exercise-induced asthma Patient developed episode of diarrhea shortly after 1st shot in series, this was followed by lowe... Read more
Close
Patient developed episode of diarrhea shortly after 1st shot in series, this was followed by lower extremity swelling and mild dyspnea on exertion, that quickly exacerbated after the 2nd shot on 5/15/2021, that resulted in severe dyspnea on exertion, severe lower extremity swelling with approximately 25 lb weight gain, orthopnea and hemoptysis. Patient reported temperatures of 99.2 F to 99.8 F. Outside CT chest abdomen pelvis angiogram showed moderate to large acute segmental/subsegmental pulmonary emboli with trace right heart strain and right lower lobe pulmonary infarction, moderate right pleural effusion, acute splenic vein thrombosis with extension to the proximal portal vein and associated splenic infarcts, bilateral renal infarcts, and evidence of portal hypertension. He was transferred to the Hospital for further management. Upon presentation here he was tachycardic but with stable blood pressures and requiring up to 5 L by nasal cannula. Initial laboratory studies were notable for WBC 21.0, INR 1.8, D-dimer 11653, NT pro-BNP 17684, troponins 603 to 579 to 574, CRP 127. He was started on a heparin infusion. He was admitted to the MICU for further management. Bedside ultrasound demonstrated reduced biventricular contractility. He was given two doses of 40 mg intravenous furosemide with about 3.5 L of urine output since admission (net negative 3.1 L). His oxygen was weaned to 1 L by nasal cannula. Lower extremity venous and arterial Dopplers were negative. Subsequent imaging demonstrated a transperineal inferior infarct with akinesis of the inferior septum, inferior and inferior lateral walls with apical and mid ventricle akinesis secondary to a complete occluded RCA. moderate pericardial effusion without tamponade noted. Upper extremity ultrasound demonstrated acute DVT in the lower right IJ, innominate, subclavian and proximal axillary veins. MRI venogram was negative for clots, but multiple acute and subacute enhancing infarcts within all 3 vasculature distributions consistent with embolic etiology were noted. TTE showed of mural thrombus along the septal and inferior walls of the LV apex, severely enlarged left ventricle with EF of 20%, severe hypokinesis. Patient was aggressively IV diuresis, with improvement in respiratory status. Maintained on high-intensity heparin for pulmonary emboli, DVT, and diffuse arterial and venous thrombosis. He was bridged to warfarin. Patient was prescribed LifeVest for primary prevention. Started on beta-blocker and ACE-inhibitor given EF. Patient planning on discharge 6/5-6/07, outcome pending.

44 2021-06-16 shortness of breath, asthma worst asthma attack he had ever had; unable to breathe; passed out/unconscious; cannot walk; lost we... Read more
Close
worst asthma attack he had ever had; unable to breathe; passed out/unconscious; cannot walk; lost weight; has no muscle left; teeth chattering; shaking; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of ASTHMA (worst asthma attack he had ever had), DYSPNOEA (unable to breathe) and LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (passed out/unconscious) in a 44-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included Intubation (The doctor told him that he would have died if they had not intubated him.) from 14-May-2021 to 21-May-2021. Concurrent medical conditions included Asthma (The patient had asthma since childhood.). Concomitant products included FLUTICASONE PROPIONATE, SALMETEROL XINAFOATE (ADVAIR) and ALBUTEROL [SALBUTAMOL] for Asthma. On 14-May-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) .5 milliliter. On 14-May-2021, the patient experienced ASTHMA (worst asthma attack he had ever had) (seriousness criteria hospitalization prolonged and life threatening), DYSPNOEA (unable to breathe) (seriousness criteria hospitalization prolonged and life threatening), LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (passed out/unconscious) (seriousness criteria hospitalization prolonged, medically significant and life threatening), TREMOR (shaking) and CHILLS (teeth chattering). On an unknown date, the patient experienced GAIT DISTURBANCE (cannot walk), WEIGHT DECREASED (lost weight) and MUSCULAR WEAKNESS (has no muscle left). The patient was hospitalized from 14-May-2021 to 31-May-2021 due to ASTHMA, DYSPNOEA and LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS. The patient was treated with Physical therapy for Gait disturbance. On 21-May-2021, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (passed out/unconscious) had resolved. At the time of the report, ASTHMA (worst asthma attack he had ever had), DYSPNOEA (unable to breathe), GAIT DISTURBANCE (cannot walk), TREMOR (shaking), WEIGHT DECREASED (lost weight), MUSCULAR WEAKNESS (has no muscle left) and CHILLS (teeth chattering) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. The treatment information included many medications and physical therapy. Company Comment Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded

Close
I was feeling cold throughout the day, at about 9:00 pm I took a shower to try to get warmed up, I just kept getting colder and colder until I was severely shaking uncontrollably. Every muscle was so tense and I was shaking so badly I could barely walk or breathe. I went to the bedroom and got under blankets with a heater and in a few minutes the shaking diminished to where I could start breathing normal again. It took about an hour before my shakiness went away completely but I still needed to stay under the blankets and near the heater as I felt I was still cold and on the verge of getting the severe chills again. I had no fever. Next morning (as I'm writing) I'm still worried about getting out of bed as I still don't feel right and am scared of getting the chills like that again.

Then Saturday 03/20/2021. afternoon he couldn?t catch his breath. I ran to get my phone and came back and he was dead. Called 911 and did CPR. 45 2021-04-19 throat swelling Pt received his first Moderna vaccine on 2/25/2021. 3 days later he developed significant oral pain ... Read more
Close
Pt received his first Moderna vaccine on 2/25/2021. 3 days later he developed significant oral pain located on the roof of his mouth, back of mouth and throat. He presented to clinic about 1 week later for evaluation. There were no obvious signs of trauma or infection at the time. He followed up with this Dentist and it was suggested he likely had a chemical burn secondary to citrus foods. He followed up with another provider and was treated with a 3 day course of an antiviral medication for herpes without any change in symptoms. He hasn't had oral herpes before, but has had shingles. He received his second Moderna vaccine on 3/25/2021 and 3 days later developed significant throat pain and swelling in his neck glands that was visible to him. His symptoms improved slightly, but have never completely resolved. He has had what feels like a dry sore throat for 7-8 weeks and intermittent white patches in the back of his mouth. He has no history of or active allergy symptoms. Was treated for oral candidiasis on 4/19/2021, but it's unclear if his vaccine triggered these symptoms.

10:10am - pt stated he felt like he was going to pass out, appears diaphoretic and pale. Pt laid on floor and raised his legs, then stated he needed to use the restroom. Pt got up and attempted to ambulate towards restroom, but began to fall forward. Pt placed in chair, increased diaphoresis and gasping respirations with "seizure like" activity and moaning. 10:12am - On site EMS assessed and attended pt. HR 45, O2 100%RA, unable to assess BP as pt removed cuff. 10:15am - 911 called, pt informed staff of his history of syncopal episodes and bradycardia 10:25am - EMS arrived 10:32am - Pt transported via Ambulance.

45 2021-04-23 lung pain massive blood clot in the right lung; painful knot under the skin on his arm; threw up about 20 time... Read more
Close
massive blood clot in the right lung; painful knot under the skin on his arm; threw up about 20 times in 6 hours, and kept vomiting all the next day; massive blood clot in the lung ended up in different parts of the lung causing extreme amount or pain\ Left lung is beginning to hurt again and his chest is killing him; next day when he got up and could barely walk; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of PULMONARY EMBOLISM (massive blood clot in the right lung), PULMONARY PAIN (massive blood clot in the lung ended up in different parts of the lung causing extreme amount or pain\ Left lung is beginning to hurt again and his chest is killing him) and THROMBOSIS (painful knot under the skin on his arm) in a 45-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 027A21A and 007B21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included Autoimmune disorder NOS in September 2020 and Broken bones. On 18-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 15-Apr-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 19-Mar-2021, the patient experienced GAIT DISTURBANCE (next day when he got up and could barely walk). On 26-Mar-2021, the patient experienced PULMONARY EMBOLISM (massive blood clot in the right lung) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, medically significant and life threatening). On 04-Apr-2021, the patient experienced PULMONARY PAIN (massive blood clot in the lung ended up in different parts of the lung causing extreme amount or pain\ Left lung is beginning to hurt again and his chest is killing him) (seriousness criterion medically significant). On an unknown date, the patient experienced THROMBOSIS (painful knot under the skin on his arm) (seriousness criterion medically significant) and VOMITING (threw up about 20 times in 6 hours, and kept vomiting all the next day). On 19-Mar-2021, GAIT DISTURBANCE (next day when he got up and could barely walk) outcome was unknown. On 28-Mar-2021, PULMONARY EMBOLISM (massive blood clot in the right lung) had not resolved. On 04-Apr-2021, PULMONARY PAIN (massive blood clot in the lung ended up in different parts of the lung causing extreme amount or pain\ Left lung is beginning to hurt again and his chest is killing him) had not resolved. At the time of the report, THROMBOSIS (painful knot under the skin on his arm) and VOMITING (threw up about 20 times in 6 hours, and kept vomiting all the next day) outcome was unknown. Not Provided Treatment information provided as blood thinners (IV heparin) and antibiotics were used to treat the events. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. This case was linked to US-MODERNATX, INC.-MOD-2021-081632 (E2B Linked Report).; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. US-MODERNATX, INC.-MOD-2021-081632:2nd dose

Close
Pt developed throat tightness, coughing and itching several minutes after her vaccination. She reports that she had similar symptoms after her first dose of Moderna on April 16. She did not notify the vaccinator of this at our site. She states she discussed this with her doctor several days prior and was told it was ok to proceed with her second dose. She premedicated with Benadryl prior to arrival. No rash noted on inspection and no definite signs of anaphylaxis. BP 140/86, SP02 97%, HR 79. Transport to the ER was recommended for extended observation period but the patient declined. She stated that her symptoms were resolving when she drove home after appx. 35 minutes of observation.

16 days after receiving my first Covid vaccine shot (The 1st of the 2 shots required) Around 7pm on May 5th I started having a hard time breathing & slight chest pains. I decided to lay down & that seemed to make it worse. Close
Patient reported symptoms of nausea and severe lightheadedness approximately 10 minutes after vaccine administration. Symptoms progressed and patient report feeling itchy with throat tightness. New onset of rash on bilateral forearms. He was elevated by Doctor with recommendation to be transported to the local Emergency Department. Patient refused to be transported and asked to stay on-site for continued observations. Patient's symptoms failed to resolve after 45 minutes, rescue team was called. They presented and evaluated patient with recommendations to be transported to the local Emergency Department. Patient declined transport to the hospital. Rescue team spoke with the Emergency Department, the decision was made and the patient agreed to an additional hour of observation with the understanding if symptoms didn't resolve they would be transported to the Emergency Department. Symptoms unchanged after 1 hour, patient made the decision to leave and follow up with their Primary Care Physician.

Close
I received my 2nd dose of the moderna vaccine on 1/24/21. On 1/25/21 at approx 2am I had tremmors, feeling of intense cold, headache, body pain, fatigue. That lasted until approx 0300am 1/26/21. I slept most of the day 1/25 except for taking kid to school and monitoring another at home. I had read the side effects and I felt as though things were subsiding on 1/26 but I was still weak with body pain. I was not 100%. I was home alone with 2 kids (wife out of town). 1/25 I had a cough and was short of breath but didn't think much of it. The cough persisted. On 1/27/21 I was still short of breath. I went to a nearby fire station and had them put me on a lifepack. I was in atrial fibrillation. I could not do anything because my wife wasn't due back until 3pm. At 3PM she walked in and I walked out and drove myself to Hospital. I was diagnosed with A-Fib w/ RVR. I was in A-fib until I was cardioverted on 2/1/21 and was given a cryo-ablation.

46 2021-02-08 shortness of breath Note: I had a PCR confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection in March, 2020. Approximately 12 hours after the ... Read more
Close
Note: I had a PCR confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection in March, 2020. Approximately 12 hours after the second vaccine dose, I experienced intense soreness at the vaccination site (significantly greater than the first dose). In the middle of the night I awoke with flu-like symptoms. At 9am I took acetominophen for fever, rigors, muscle aches. This brought mild relief from approx. 9:45am to 11:15 am. My condition continued to worsen through the early afternoon with rigors and significant generalized muscle aches. I experienced tachycardia (90-105 bpm vs normal of ~70bpm), SOB, and starting measuring pulse oximetry which read from 89%-94% (my usual does not go below 97%). This persisted until approximately 8pm with no improvement. I took 40 mg prednisone, 600 mg ibuprofen and within 3 hours was starting to have symptom resolution. I am a physician and up to date on all my vaccinations. I have never had anything approaching this type of response. I don't know if prior SARS-CoV-2 infection creates a situation were the very potent mRNA vaccine triggers a large immunologic recall response. I wanted to get this noted as there may be some reason to alter the vaccine schedule for prior SARS-CoV-2 infections

Symptoms worsened every time he tried to get up. Woke up this AM, with symptoms persisting. Came in for OV, BP noted to be elevated at 150/106. Patient was sent to hospital via ambulance for further work-up and management.

Around 2:35 he and his family notified me that he was feeling lightheaded/faint and nauseous; he also appeared pale and diaphoretic. It seemed to be a vasovagal reaction until he said he was starting to have trouble breathing so I called 911 and got the Epipen/emergency kit ready, and monitored vitals. Then his breathing trouble resolved without needing to administer medication. EMS arrived at 2:39 pm and confirmed his HR/BP/O2 sat were normal. EMS cleared the patient to go home with his family. Close
After 5 mins of getting the 1st shot I felt an allergic reaction little bit hard to breathe and hot flash. I told the pharmacist and was advised to stay an extra 10 minutes. I left the Pharmacy and proceeded to the store and then home. Over the next 1.5 days I felt a sort of brain fog, my arm puffed up red about the size of a half dollar. The brain fog went away and then for the next 2-3 days my body felt like I was coming down with a cold. I seemed to feel better after that initial period until 3/24 when while driving a hot flash came over me and the next day I was again in a type of brain fog. For the next two days I tried to just deal with the brain fog but started to notice on the right side of my neck a feeling of constriction, with abnormally high blood pressure. I went to the hospital ER and the completed a CAT scan of my brain and neck, blood work and urine work up with no evidence of why my neck was feeling constricted and high blood pressure. The symptoms continued and on 4/1 my blood pressure spike to 168/93 and I again went back to the hospital ER and spent the night. I was having heart palpitations, anxiety and very high blood pressure. The hospital this time completed more bloodwork, MRI of my brain and neck and an Eco-cardiogram. I am now on 3 blood pressure and heart medications and have no diagnoses of why my blood pressure and heart rate are so abnormal. I am very healthy and exercise daily and have never encountered this and my BP has always been extremely good.

46 2021-05-26 shortness of breath Difficulty breathing; Covid-19 symptoms; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequen... Read more
Close
Difficulty breathing; Covid-19 symptoms; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of DYSPNOEA (Difficulty breathing) in a 46-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. Unknown) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 17-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 22-Apr-2021, the patient experienced COVID-19 (Covid-19 symptoms). On 06-May-2021, the patient experienced DYSPNOEA (Difficulty breathing) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). At the time of the report, DYSPNOEA (Difficulty breathing) and COVID-19 (Covid-19 symptoms) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 02-May-2021, SARS-CoV-2 test: negative (Negative) Negative. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. Concomitant product use was not provided by the reporter. On 06-May-2021, started with breathing issues, and although being negative for covid-19 since 02-May-2021, had to go to hospital to receive treatment. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. The mRNA-1273 does not contain a virus capable of causing infection and with the occurrence of COVID-19 infection after vaccination, the causality of the COVID-19 event is assessed as not applicable.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. The mRNA-1273 does not contain a virus capable of causing infection and with the occurrence of COVID-19 infection after vaccination, the causality of the COVID-19 event is assessed as not applicable.

47 2021-01-13 shortness of breath 2-3 min after vaccination he started feeling tingling in the right side of his face. About one minut... Read more
Close
2-3 min after vaccination he started feeling tingling in the right side of his face. About one minute later he felt like he could not get a full breath and he felt the need to run away. We connected a heart monitor, did serial vital signs, listen to lung sounds. He symptoms seem to worsen. He did not have hives, his lungs were clear. His HR was normal but his B/P was elevated. We started and IV and gave him 25 mg mg of IV Benadryl. We contacted Dr. via phone. He talked to the patient and he agreed with our assessment and treatment. He began feeling better about 10 min after the Benadryl and he symptoms cleared by 30 min after Benadryl. We kept him on the heart monitor for 1 hour. He reported he felt fine and back to normal when he left to go home. He refused ambulance transport to the hospital. All reports will be filled out by me.
47 2021-01-14 shortness of breath My blood pressure went up to 170/106 and my heart was beating over 100 about 45 minutes or one hour ... Read more
Close
My blood pressure went up to 170/106 and my heart was beating over 100 about 45 minutes or one hour after I was vaccinated, and I also felt nausea. Nurse called 911, and I was transported to emergency. About 1.5 hour later, my heart was even beating more quickly, and I could hardly talked and difficult to breathe. This happened when I walked to the restroom by myself and came back. After they did some medical tests, gave me medication for allergy (the doctor gave me this since he was not sure if it was my allergy reaction to the vaccines), injected 2 IV bags and rest for few hours, my blood pressure went down to about 140/9x and heart beat back to normal. I was released from ER on the next day at 4:00am.

47 2021-02-15 shortness of breath 48 hours post vaccine, patient developed low grade fever and respiratory complaints including shortn... Read more
Close
48 hours post vaccine, patient developed low grade fever and respiratory complaints including shortness of breath. chest x ray showed RUL consolidation. when patient wosened over the next 48 hours from respiratory standpoint including new oxygen requirement and hypotension, decision was made to perform chest ct which confirmed presence of RUL pneumonia. the following day, the patient was bronched and the resultant bronchial alveolar lavage that was performed has thus far been completely negative. repeat chest xray four days later showed resolution of RUL consolidation and patient was no longer symptomatic.

47 2021-02-26 shortness of breath On 2/23/21, about 12 days after the vaccine was received, I felt chest pains in the late afternoon. ... Read more
Close
On 2/23/21, about 12 days after the vaccine was received, I felt chest pains in the late afternoon. At midnight, I woke up with uncontrollable chills and shakes, with a low-grade fever that hovered in the 99.5 -100 range. I attempted to get up and struggled to breathe,; it was as if my abdominal and lower back muscles were seizing. I had to crawl to a kneeling position to urinate. I took several Tylenol then went back to lie down; after a few hours, the fever subsided, and I was able to briefly fall back asleep. At 4:00 a.m. the fever and major chills subsided, with no fevers reported since then, and only occasional chills. However, the muscle fatigue, pain and stiffness have become frighteningly debilitating. On Wednesday - Friday, the three days after I first experienced symptoms, each day it took me between 1.5 - 2 hours to get out of bed and finally get to a standing position. During the day on each day following my first symptoms, I have been able to gradually walk around, go up and down stairs, use the bathroom, and perform basic tasks. However, when the evening comes, it is a different story. 12 midnight - 10 a.m. are the worst hours, as any extended period lying down results in my muscles seizing, freezing and stiffening up. After falling asleep for an hour, it takes 10-20 minutes to mobilize enough (using a crutch and assistance) to get to the bathroom. After falling asleep for 2-3 hours, it takes 30-40 minutes to do the same. And, if I fall asleep for 3+ hours (which is about as long as I've been able to sleep since the adverse reactions began), it will take 1.5 - 2 hours to get completely mobile. This is when I finally wake for the day, and it takes about 10 minutes to raise my head and turn my torso, then another 10-15 minutes to get my legs off the bed and assume a crouching position, then 30-60 minutes to stand on my own.

Approximately 45 minutes after injection mild onset of anaphylaxis response. Numb tongue, tingly lips, mild throat constriction but no issues swallowing or breathing. About 60 minutes post-injection, the patient self-administered two 25 mg tablets of Benadryl. Symptoms subsided 120 minutes later.

He took my heart rate and check my blood sugar. He said my vitals looked ok. He asked if i was feeling better. I was still very dizzy and nauseous. i sat in the parking log for awhile before driving home. I got home and went to bed slept most of the day. I had a fairly bad headache the rest of the evening and a slight nauseous feeling. The next morning i still have a slight headache still feel slight nausea but not bad.

47 2021-03-17 shortness of breath He received his Moderna vaccine and was sitting in waiting area with his spouse for his 15 minute po... Read more
Close
He received his Moderna vaccine and was sitting in waiting area with his spouse for his 15 minute post vaccine wait. RN was alerted that he did not feel well. RN #1 assessed him and gave him 10ml of Benadryl liquid due to his complaints of itchy/scratchy throat and difficulty breathing. Heart rate was 80 and respirations were 20. He reported he last ate at 8pm the night before and was too nervous to eat breakfast. RN #2 provided him with fruit juice and sliced apples. He reported feeling better and then two minutes later complained of feeling hot and cold and foggy headed and not right with some anxiety. RN #1 called local EMS/Fire Rescue and they arrived to assess him. Vital signs were within normal limits. He was transported to Hospital for further evaluation. He was alert and oriented and able to ambulate to EMS/Fire Rescue vehicle.
47 2021-03-23 shortness of breath, throat tightness Patient had trouble breathing and took his inhaler. He continued to have trouble breathing and said ... Read more
Close
Patient had trouble breathing and took his inhaler. He continued to have trouble breathing and said his throat and chest felt tight. EMT gave 20ml of benadryl and assessed patient. Gave another 20ml of Benadryl. EMT asked and reassessed in 5 - 10 minutes. Patient still felt tightness and said it was getting worse. EMT asked if he wanted epi and patient said yes and said his throat was closing more. EMT explained that he would need to go to the hospital then and patient did not want to go to the hospital. Continued assessment and patient stated he was feeling better after EMT had him drink water and do some deep breathing. Patient stated he felt much better and was released from waiting room. Nurse at employer (Clinic was done on site) stated that this is normal for patient to have SOB as he has COPD and commonly has shortness of breath.
47 2021-04-08 very rapid breathing Patient was coherent during initial injection, as I removed my gloves and asked he remain in the wai... Read more
Close
Patient was coherent during initial injection, as I removed my gloves and asked he remain in the waiting area for 15 minutes his chin fell to his chest and he began to breath heavily. I spoke to him and there was no response. He then began making snoring type noises and lifted his head but again was unresponsive. Patient then slumped sideways in the chair. I made one last attempt to arouse him with firm strikes to the chest and calling his name. I retrieved the EpiPen from the e-kit and as I removed it from the box he became conscious. He opened his eyes and gasped and tremored slightly. He was not immediately responsive verbally. I observed him carefully to evaluate if he was going to have a seizure, but he then became coherent. He was alert and oriented to time and place but did ask how ling it had been since the vaccine. He admitted to having a problem with needles and stated that was the root of the reaction. He does not remember any reactions to previous vaccines but also could not recall his last vaccination. We brought the patient water and offered snacks while he recovered in the patient care area. Approximately 20-30 minutes after the initial event the patient began vomiting. After a few minutes of vomiting he said he felt a little better and wanted to go to his car to lay down. Multiple times we asked if we could call someone to come pick him up and offered to have him seen by paramedics that happened to be shopping in store. He declined both offers and stated he would lie down in his car and call someone if he did not feel well after awhile. Staff checked on him in his car and he was instructed to call in before leaving. Upon trying to check on him again it was noted his car was gone. I called the patient and he assured me he was ok and he was now at home.

He said this pain is causing some difficulty breathing. He said his dad witnessed the fall. When asked if the pain is severe, he said "yes". He was told that if he's experiencing "severe" pain after a fall, accompanied with difficulty breathing, he should seek medical attention. He was told he can contact his Dr. for a second opinion first, if desired. Otherwise, it was suggested he check his BP, if possible, sit with head between knees or lay down with feet propped up and NOT walk around if feeling dizzy. He was advised to stay hydrated and introduce bland foods first to see if he can tolerate solid food. He was told he can take whatever oral pain reliever he normally takes that he's allowed to take if needed. Patient will report back to me.

47 2021-04-22 shortness of breath Difficulty in breathing; Swelling of face; Swelling of face and tongue; This spontaneous case was re... Read more
Close
Difficulty in breathing; Swelling of face; Swelling of face and tongue; This spontaneous case was reported by a health care professional (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of DYSPNOEA (Difficulty in breathing), SWELLING FACE (Swelling of face) and SWOLLEN TONGUE (Swelling of face and tongue) in a 47-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 031A21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. Concurrent medical conditions included Penicillin allergy (Not sure about the allergy). On 15-Apr-2021 at 1:52 PM, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 15-Apr-2021 at 2:22 PM, the patient experienced DYSPNOEA (Difficulty in breathing) (seriousness criteria medically significant and intervention required), SWELLING FACE (Swelling of face) (seriousness criteria medically significant and intervention required) and SWOLLEN TONGUE (Swelling of face and tongue) (seriousness criteria medically significant and intervention required). At the time of the report, DYSPNOEA (Difficulty in breathing), SWELLING FACE (Swelling of face) and SWOLLEN TONGUE (Swelling of face and tongue) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. EpiPen and 50 mg of Benadryl were given intramuscularly as a treatment for the events. 9-1-1 was called for further evaluation. No information on concomitant medications. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

He says it happened 2-3 minutes after receiving his vaccine and sitting down, but it went away. He says it came and went away another time, but this time it stayed. He was able to swallow water and his medication without difficulty. 1144: 129/87, P 89 1156: 139/81, P 87 (reports the feeling of his tightening throat is easing; denies itching to the throat, tongue not swollen, no rash observed) 1210: Reports feeling flushed, BP 139/81, P 83. (he says he's feeling his anxiety rising and says he will take 1/2 Xanax when he leaves) 1215-denies symptoms at this time. Actions taken: Vitals sign taken VAERS form obtained and completed by RN. Disposition: Reports no further symptoms of adverse reaction after observation for additional 30 minutes minutes. Discharged home. Instructed to call 911 for trouble breathing, rapid heart rate, dizziness, swelling of tongue or throat. 1215 ambulatory out.

48 2021-04-19 shortness of breath, mild apnea Pt received second dose moderna vaccine. Did not bring first dose vaccine card, unable to obtain fir... Read more
Close
Pt received second dose moderna vaccine. Did not bring first dose vaccine card, unable to obtain first dose lot number and date of vaccination from patient. Pt left facility and upon approaching stop light in front of building, pt began to experience SOB with fast heart rate and mouth dryness. Pt returned to facility to seek medical attention. Brought to med obs #1 via wheelchair by staff for evaluation. Reports mild improvement of symptoms upon arrival to med obs. No s/s of distress noted upon pt arrival. Pt reports taking prescribed lisinopril PTA this AM. Upon assessment of VS, BP elevated. Pt states he occasionally has SBP 200+/DBP 100+. Denies s/s of anxiety at present and denies headache/vision changes. VS are as follows: 1314: BP 187/107 (RUE), rechecked on LUE 233/134, HR 75, RR 17, O2 sat 98% on RA. 1319: BP 233/118 (LUE), rechecked on RUE 242/122, HR 104, RR 16, O2 sat 99% on RA. Per VS parameters, pt qualifies for EMS transport for ER evaluation of elevated BP. Notified in-house PA of need for assessment and confirmation of EMS need for transport as well as notification to lead supervisor. Constable at employee entrance notified to assist in arriving EMS. Upon assessment of pt by PA, pt disclosed he is non-compliant with prescribed lisinopril at home and will occasionally use medication PRN or double/triple his dosage based on symptoms. PA provided education on proper use of lisinopril and confirmed need for higher level of care. Pt agreeable to EMS transport for further evaluation. 9-1-1 called. While awaiting EMS arrival, pt reported sweating of hands and shallow breathing, stating, "I feel like I have to concentrate on my breathing now." Pt not in distress. EMS arrived to transport pt to Hospital. Pt alert and oriented x4 and ambulatory from stretcher to EMS gurney upon transfer. VS while awaiting EMS arrival are as follows: 1324: BP 249/126, HR 83, RR 17, O2 sat 100% on RA 1329: BP 247/109, HR 85, RR 18, O2 sat 100% on RA 1336: BP 243/112, HR 84, RR 20, O2 sat 100% on RA 1347: BP 245/144, HR 87, RR 18, O2 sat 100% on RA
48 2021-04-25 shortness of breath Patient received the 2nd Moderna vaccine on 4/19/2021. On 4/20/21, patient had typical side effects ... Read more
Close
Patient received the 2nd Moderna vaccine on 4/19/2021. On 4/20/21, patient had typical side effects such as fever, fatigue, headache, and arm soreness. Patient took Tylenol to treat symptoms. On 4/21/21, patient said he started to develop swelling around base of neck on both sides and had difficulty breathing. He stated that he also had right arm numbness where the injection was given as well as blurry vision. According to patient, his blood pressure was 220/145 and his blood glucose was over 300. Patient went to primary care physician on 4/26/21 about his neck still being swollen after his vaccination. He said his physician gave him diphenhydramine and a steroid shot for the reaction. Patient came to the pharmacy to report his side effects on 4/26/2021.

Close
#1 = 011J20A on 1-6-21 #2 = 028L20A on 2-3-21 patient presented after sudden onset of chest pain early in morning and found to be covid +. ECG demonstrated diffuse ST elevation, troponins negative. CT without contrast didn't have much in it. He was found to be COVID rapid test+ and IGG negative. He was admitted into isolation, no oxygen needs. DDIMER was over 2000 and friction rub noted on physical exam. Cardiology ruled out STEMI, thought maybe viral pericarditis - but wanted echo done after out of isolation. CTA was planned for AM on 4-28-21, but patient died 4-27-21 PM after being found down in room. ROSC was not able to be achieved despite aggressive resuscitation efforts

EMS arrived, patient stopped breathing, was bagged until arrival at hospital where he was intubated. 5/12 Patient was extubated and died in early AM 5/13. Close
PATIENT WAS NOT NERVOUS ABOUT RECEIVING HIS FIRST DOSE. OUR IMMUNIZATION CERTIFIED PHARMACY TECH ADMINISTERED THE DOSE. ABOUT 2 MINUTES LATER HE STATED HE WAS FEELING TINGLY AND HIS EAR TURNED A WHITE COLOR. THE TECHNICIAN CALLED ME INTO THE ROOM WHERE I EXAMINED THE PATIENT. HE WAS NOT RESPONDING AND HIS EYES WERE DILATED. HE WAS TRYING TO BREATH BUT HE WAS HAVING DIFFICULTY. WE MOVED HIM TO THE GROUND AND PLACED HIM ON HIS SIDE TO MAKE SURE HE DID NOT ASPERATE. AFTER ABOUT 20 SECONDS OF BEING ON THE GROUD HE STARTED BREATHING NORMALLY AND WAS CONSCIOUS. THE ENTIRE EPISODE LASTED ABOUT 1 MINUTE (MAYBE SLIGHLY LONGER). EMS ARRIVED A FEW MINUTES LATER. HIS PULSE WAS LOW (ABOUT 50 BPM PER EMS) BUT HIS BLOOD PRESSURE WAS NORMAL (UNSURE OF THE VALUE). HE SAID HE REMEMBERED TALKING TO US AND THE NEXT THING HE KNEW HE WAS LAYING ON THE GROUND. HE WAS VERY NAUSEOUS AFTERWARDS FOR ABOUT 45 MINUTES (HE THREW UP TWICE). WE CONTACTED THE PATIENT THE DAY AFTER AND HE SAID HE WAS FINE AND THAT HE ONLY HAD A SORE ARM. WE BELIEVE THAT HIS BLOOD PRESSURE DROPPED TOO LOW AND CAUSED A VASOVAGAL TYPE RESPONSE.

Close
Patient came to the pharmacist for help about 5 minutes after his immunization, he was shaky. When the pharmacist came out to check on him, he collapsed. He was shaky, sweating, complaining of being on fire. He was given a bottle of water after asking for water. The patient then alternately complained of having trouble breathing and feeling better for several cycles. The EMS arrived about 20 minutes after being called and the pharmacist left the patient in the care of the EMT's. EMS left about 1/2 an hour later, then the patient's wife showed up to take him home. After 6pm, the patient was checked on by the pharmacist and he was doing well at that time.

49 2021-01-14 respiratory distress, shortness of breath, exercise-induced asthma Onset of shortness of breath and cough on 1/3 that progressively got worse. Clinical diagnosis of pn... Read more
Close
Onset of shortness of breath and cough on 1/3 that progressively got worse. Clinical diagnosis of pneumonia without fever was made, patient started azithromycin on 1/5 and albuterol treatments every 4-6 hrs. Initially he improved, but then worsened. chest xray on 1/6 was negative for pneumonia, PCR covid test was negative, albuterol treatment did not bring much relief. He started respiratory distress on 1/10 and was taken by car to the local ER where another covid test was negative and chest CT revealed multiple bilateral pulmonary emboli. The leg US revealed blood clots in both of his legs. He had an emergency catheter-delivered thrombolysis and was discharged home from the ICU on 1/12 on oral anticoagulants. He is gradually improving, but very weak. He tires easily and gets a drop in oxygen to 90- 93%, as well as an increase in the heart rate to 120 when walking less than half a mile. He runs out of breath with exertion.

49 2021-03-02 mild apnea Administered Moderna vaccination at 1746 and patient stated that he has experienced vagal responses ... Read more
Close
Administered Moderna vaccination at 1746 and patient stated that he has experienced vagal responses to injections in the past. Patient remained in the vaccination chair for 5 minutes after injection and he reported feeling well and moved to the observation chair without any problems [~10ft]. After being the observation chair patient stood up and took 4-5 steps toward the wall and sat down on the floor. The patient stated he felt dizzy and then became limp & slumped to the right side, eyes remained open with dilation of pupil fixed at 2mm with no blinking noted. Patient's breathing pattern became shallow & snoring sounds noted. Patient did not respond when spoken to nor did he respond to soft shaking of shoulders. Patient began to demonstrate large jerky body movements similar to seizure activity. The seizure like activity continued for 3-4 minutes before the patient was able to become aware of surroundings and answer orientation questions. BP 120/72, HR 64, O2 sats 99%, RR 20. Patient was diaphoretic, pale, shaking of hands and arms, restlessness of lower limbs with frequent repositioning/twitching of legs. EMS arrived to find the patient regaining stability. Patient reported to EMS that his is familiar with this type of response and declined to be taken to

Severe shaking to the point I could barely walk, talk, or function in general. In fact, had to end work conference call due to effects. My wife continued to monitor me to make sure I didn't collapse or pass out and continually ask if we should go to the ER. However, after about 25 minutes the shaking subsided and I was left exhausted with some minor muscle pain due to shaking. It was very difficult to breath during the incident, noticed my hands turning blue so I focused on deep breaths and staying calm to eventually stop it.

49 2021-04-04 shortness of breath On Friday, 4/2/21, a client (49 yr old male) arrived to the 30 minute Vaccine Recovery lot after COV... Read more
Close
On Friday, 4/2/21, a client (49 yr old male) arrived to the 30 minute Vaccine Recovery lot after COVID 19 Moderna Lot# 020B21A administration at 11:40am. Patient had reported history of rash after taking both Cipro and Penicillin. At 11:55 am while pt was being assessed by vaccine recovery lot, pt reported sudden onset of involuntary movements and mild shortness of breath. The EMT called for the Vaccine Recovery Lot Medical Lead. Began assessing patient at 11:57 am, noting the pt was having involuntary movements of the upper and lower extremities every few seconds. 12:00 pm BP 152/98, pulse 65. Patient was alert and oriented with normal skin color. Pt reported feeling anxious and "maybe it is all in my head". Pt reported the blood pressure on scene was " higher than my normal at 120s/80s. Pt denied any history of recent illness or other vaccines. Pt stated, " I should have known something would happen, I had a premonition about this". Repeat vital signs at 12:32 pm BP 152/98 and pulse 65. Pt continued to have episodes of the involuntary upper and lower extremities lasting approx 3-5 minutes per episode. NP explained to pt that she could not allow him to drive with these movements and pt agreed to evaluation with EMS and transport to local ER for further evaluation. NP instructed to call for EMS. Call was made at 12:48pm and EMS/Fire arrived onsite shortly after. While awaiting Fire Department and EMS, pt reported to NP, "I have a history of Aspergers Syndrome". Also NP spoke with pt's spouse who also agreed pt should be evaluated at local ER. He was transported to the local hospital.

Few days later started to have chest pain, shortness of breath that progressed and eventually was severe. seen at ER 2/22/21 and found to have large pericardial effusion on bedside u/s and acute ST changes on EKG. transferred to second hospital and admitted 2/22/21-2/25/21. He was treated with pericardial windows to remove fluid and discharged on ibuprofen and colchicine for presumed viral pericarditis.

Patient is a personal acquaintance of reporter. Patient contacted reporter on 4/15/21 at 10:18 pm complaining of onset of extreme dizziness, vomiting, "eyes not catching up with my head", extreme fatigue, and feeling like they are "about to pass out". Patient also noted onset of SOB and lower chest pain accompanied by "weird taste" but not metallic taste. Patient was unable to describe the unusual taste. Patient was encouraged to use OTC medications to treat headache and fever, encouraged to use OTC Benadryl/Dramamine. Monitor for worsening and report to ER if symptoms worsened, changed, or failed to improve. Per patient, symptoms lasted through the night and until approximately 3:00 AM on 4/16/21. Patient's wife reported blood sugar of 154 mg/dl, B/P 164/88, and Pulse 70 bpm using home monitors. On 4/16/21, the patient reported onset of fever greater than 101 at approximately 2:00-3:00 AM which lasted approximately 18 hours. 49 2021-05-01 throat swelling When I woke up this morning I could feel my throat was swollen and I had slight difficulty ingesting... Read more
Close
When I woke up this morning I could feel my throat was swollen and I had slight difficulty ingesting saliva. But I was able to drink water without too much problem. After a while when I was brushing my teeth I realized I could not gargle. I did not pay much attention. When I tried to eat breakfast I realized that I was not able to ingest any solid food at all. Then I realized my voice had become very hoarse. When I told my wife about it (she is a pediatrician) she looked into my mouth to check uvula but could not see it. She pointed out it could be an allergic reaction but was not sure of the reason. I took liquid Benadryl which we had at home and she also gave me a table of famotidine. I also had prednisone but did not take that as as I did not want anything to hurt vaccine's immunity effect. However, out of caution we drove to an ER and waited in its parking lot for an hour. Slowly I noticed that my swelling had reduced and I was able to see a little bit of uvula. So we decided to come back home. I am feeling much better now though not fully normal.

49 2021-05-28 mild apnea Seizure like phenomena; Breath sounds abnormal; Dizziness; Dyskinesia; Eyelid function disorder; Fal... Read more
Close
Seizure like phenomena; Breath sounds abnormal; Dizziness; Dyskinesia; Eyelid function disorder; Fall; Hyperhidrosis; Hypopnoea; Hypotonia; Muscle twitching; Pallor; Presyncope; Restless legs syndrome; Tremor; This case was received via FDA VAERS on 18-May-2021 and was forwarded to Moderna on 18-May-2021. This regulatory authority case was reported by an other health care professional and describes the occurrence of SEIZURE LIKE PHENOMENA (Seizure like phenomena) in a 49-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 011A21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included Vagal reaction (patient stated he has experienced vagal responses to injections in the past). On 02-Mar-2021 at 5:46 PM, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 02-Mar-2021, the patient experienced SEIZURE LIKE PHENOMENA (Seizure like phenomena) (seriousness criterion medically significant). 02-Mar-2021, the patient experienced BREATH SOUNDS ABNORMAL (Breath sounds abnormal), DIZZINESS (Dizziness), DYSKINESIA (Dyskinesia), EYELID FUNCTION DISORDER (Eyelid function disorder), FALL (Fall), HYPERHIDROSIS (Hyperhidrosis), HYPOPNOEA (Hypopnoea), HYPOTONIA (Hypotonia), MUSCLE TWITCHING (Muscle twitching), PALLOR (Pallor), PRESYNCOPE (Presyncope), RESTLESS LEGS SYNDROME (Restless legs syndrome) and TREMOR (Tremor). At the time of the report, SEIZURE LIKE PHENOMENA (Seizure like phenomena), BREATH SOUNDS ABNORMAL (Breath sounds abnormal), DIZZINESS (Dizziness), DYSKINESIA (Dyskinesia), EYELID FUNCTION DISORDER (Eyelid function disorder), FALL (Fall), HYPERHIDROSIS (Hyperhidrosis), HYPOPNOEA (Hypopnoea), HYPOTONIA (Hypotonia), MUSCLE TWITCHING (Muscle twitching), PALLOR (Pallor), PRESYNCOPE (Presyncope), RESTLESS LEGS SYNDROME (Restless legs syndrome) and TREMOR (Tremor) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 02-Mar-2021, Blood pressure measurement: 120/72 (normal) 120/72 mmHg. On 02-Mar-2021, Heart rate: 64 (normal) 64 beats per minute. On 02-Mar-2021, Oxygen saturation: 99 (normal) 99%. On 02-Mar-2021, Respiratory rate: 20 (normal) 20 breaths per minute. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. No concomitant medications were provided. The patient remained in the vaccination chair for 5 minutes after injection and he reported feeling well and moved to the observation chair without any problems [~10ft]. After being in the observation chair the patient stood up and took 4-5 steps toward the wall and sat down on the floor. The patient stated he felt dizzy and then became limp and slumped to the right side, his eyes remained open with dilation of pupil fixed at 2mm with no blinking noted. The patient's breathing pattern became shallow and snoring sounds were noted. The patient did not respond when spoken to nor did he respond to soft shaking of the shoulders. The patient began to demonstrate large jerky body movements similar to seizure activity. The seizure like activity continued for 3-4 minutes before the patient was able to become aware of surroundings and answer orientation questions. The patient was diaphoretic, pale, shaking of hands and arms, restlessness of lower limbs with frequent repositioning/twitching of legs. EMS (emergency medical services) arrived to find the patient regaining stability. The patient reported to EMS that he is familiar with this type of response and declined to be taken anywhere. Treatment medications were not reported. Based on current available information and the temporal association between product use and the start date of the event a causal relationship cannot be excluded. The Company believes the event of Restless leg syndrome is not supported in the source documents and should be delete.; Sender's Comments: Based on current available information and the temporal association between product use and the start date of the event a causal relationship cannot be excluded. The Company believes the event of Restless leg syndrome is not supported in the source documents and should be delete.

heart disorder; Inappropriate schedule of vaccine administered; started feeling short of breath; pain in the back and chest; pain in the back and chest; pain bone; chills; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of CARDIAC DISORDER (heart disorder) in a 49-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. 007S21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. Concurrent medical conditions included Diabetes and Blood pressure high (Patient was diagnosed at the hospital) on 19-Mar-2021. On 04-Apr-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 04-Apr-2021, the patient experienced BONE PAIN (pain bone) and CHILLS (chills). On 16-May-2021, the patient experienced DYSPNOEA (started feeling short of breath), CHEST PAIN (pain in the back and chest) and BACK PAIN (pain in the back and chest). On 19-May-2021, the patient experienced CARDIAC DISORDER (heart disorder) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). On an unknown date, the patient experienced PRODUCT DOSE OMISSION ISSUE (Inappropriate schedule of vaccine administered). The patient was hospitalized on 19-Mar-2021 due to CARDIAC DISORDER. The patient was treated with IBUPROFEN at an unspecified dose and frequency. On 06-Apr-2021, BONE PAIN (pain bone) and CHILLS (chills) had resolved. At the time of the report, CARDIAC DISORDER (heart disorder), DYSPNOEA (started feeling short of breath), CHEST PAIN (pain in the back and chest), BACK PAIN (pain in the back and chest) and PRODUCT DOSE OMISSION ISSUE (Inappropriate schedule of vaccine administered) outcome was unknown. The action taken with mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was unknown. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Patient received medications for diabetes and high blood pressure however, drug names were not provided. Company comment: This case concerns a 49-year-old male patient who missed the appointment to be given the second dose of the vaccine because of symptoms (Product dose omission). The other events show temporal association with the use of mRNA-1273 and, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Nausea is consistent with the product known safety profile of the product. The event of product dose omission is not applicable. 50 2021-03-22 mild apnea After I got the shot, on the way home, I started feeling tingling on tongue and lips; had a metallic... Read more
Close
After I got the shot, on the way home, I started feeling tingling on tongue and lips; had a metallic taste. I felt like I had allergies - I was a little congested - but the next morning, 04:00 am - I was still congested - and was still breathing short and shallow. I get to work and I'm open mouth breathing - not breathing correctly. It felt like my lungs were swollen on the inside and throat was swollen on inside. Couldn't palpate and feel it but just couldn't access the lower lungs breathing-wise. Started getting dizzy and couldn't think - from 05:00 am to 09:00 am - and I decided I couldn't work anymore. I went to headquarters and I couldn't talk from lack of breathing - would have to stop just to think or just to breathe. I drove by the clinic where I was got my vaccine and decided to go in - I was so dizzy and I realized I shouldn't be driving. They told me to get up and move and I told them I couldn't breathe and I'm not one to say that but they called an ambulance that took me ER. (I was a LPN at one time so I wasn't anxious.) And they told me it was anxiety - and they kept telling me to breathe. But it wasn't an anxiety attack at all. My heartrate was normal. I was shallow breathing. They gave me a paper bag to breathe into. That's it .I was there for a couple of hours. They had told me to rest. I shouldn't have gotten out of bed that morning - my body just didn't want to move. I felt a little better after a couple of hours and people helped me from there to get home. After that, I felt better - about 4 pm or 5 pm. Second vaccine - felt flu like symptoms for three days after. I still feel a little weird - my bones hurt and I'm achy. Just not feeling right. Note: When I was in the emergency room - my hands were purple. Circulation was weird.They told me my oxygen levels were fine and that I just needed to breathe. It caused carpal tunnel in my wrist - I had nerve damage on that about three weeks - I have about 80 percent nerve damage from previous and so when something irritates it - it takes a while to recover from it but I have. I consulted with a doctor about the reaction to first vaccine before getting the second vaccine.

50 year old male with history of allergic rhinitis, currently on AIT, presents for follow up. Since last seen he initiated AIT in December 2020 and reports he had tolerated his AIT injections without large local or systemic reactions until yesterday, 16 Mar, when he received his first maintenance dose. Within minutes of receiving his dose he developed shortness of breath, dizziness/altered level of consciousness resulting in collapse, and was noted to be hypoxic. He was treated with IM epinephrine with initial improvement but subsequently again developed shortness of breath, cough and altered level of consciousness. He received his second dose of IM epinephrine and a dose of IM Benadryl with transient improvement, but again developed shortness of breath, cough and altered level of consciousness followed by nausea and vomiting. He was noted to be hypotensive and hypoxic despite these interventions so a third dose of IM epinephrine and IV fluids were administered. He was transferred by ambulance to ER where he was given IV solumedrol, monitored, and admitted to the ICU overnight for observation. He reports fever (Tmax 101 F) last night in the ICU. He endorses he took his Allegra prior to his AIT dose and did not exercise. Of note, on 15 Mar he received his second mRNA COVID19 vaccine.

50 2021-04-20 throat tightness After both the first and second vaccine shots, I had the same reaction. 15 to 20 minutes after the ... Read more
Close
After both the first and second vaccine shots, I had the same reaction. 15 to 20 minutes after the shot, I felt a numbness in my mouth. I also had a slight throat constriction sensation that I know well given my history with severe allergic reactions to tree nuts. However, to be clear, the reaction to the vaccine shots was far more mild than my reaction to tree nuts. If I eat any tree nuts, I have a severe reaction that involves throat closure, hives, vomiting and related symptoms for 6-8 hours. While the Epipen shot helps with keeping my throat open, it does not reduce all of the other symptoms. Here, the throat constriction was only approx. 1/100th of the reaction I have when I eat tree nuts. Further, the slight throat constriction and mouth numbness only lasted 10-15 minutes, as compared to 6-8 hours if I eat tree nuts. I did not need to use an Epipen.

Close
Patient complained of tingling to his hands 15 minutes post-vaccination. Patient had no other s/sx of reaction. Patient observed for another 15 minutes and tingling did not worsen. Patient left observation area and returned to work. Patient returned to observation area around 4:40 p.m. and complained that tingling to hands was still present and he felt tightness in his forearms. Patient is a coach for the children and was outside in the 90+ degree heat during the afternoon. Patient came into observation area to cool down. Patient's blood pressure taken and was elevated, although patient stated that he had HTN. Paramedics called on site to evaluate patient. Patient began to complain of dizziness and was transported to local hospital. On the way to the hospital, the patient developed chest pain and shortness of breath. Patient was diagnosed with a non-STEMI at the hospital and transferred to higher level of care. The patient is currently undergoing observation and tests to determine the cause of the MI. The patient received epinephrine 0.5 ml at the hospital to cover any underlying vaccine reaction.

Patient presented for second dose of Moderna Vaccination. At 1300pm, patient stated he started to feel sweaty and weak. Vitals were taken, BP 134/82 P 74 R 18 O2 98%. Lungs clear on auscultation. Patient verbalized that he has a history of anxiety and only drank one cup of coffee today with no other fluid intake. Patient denied H/A, C/P, SOB and nausea at this time. Patient verbalized that he was starting to feel better. Patient was monitored by nurse during this time. Within a few minutes the patient started to get upset and stated that he felt like he was going to pass out and that his left leg felt weak. Patient was red, flushed, diaphoretic, and appeared anxious with increased respiratory effort. Cardiac monitor in use, normal sinus rhythm analyzed. O2 applied at 2LNC. Patient stated that he wanted to lay on the floor. Patient transferred to stretcher by EMS. BP 146/76 P 76 R 20 O2 99% 2L NC Patient verbalized that he wanted to be transported to the hospital.

Close
Information below was sourced from the patient record in the hospital EHR system: Patient presented to ED with PMH of HTN and family history of premature CAD who presented with 2 hours duration of substernal chest discomfort. He had been in his usual state of health prior to this evening. He received the COVID Vaccine on 5/12/21. He went out with his wife for dinner and then upon return, started to have some substernal chest discomfort radiating down his arm. This is associated with some SOB and nausea. No vomiting, no diaphoresis. The pain continued for about 2 hours and then he decided to come to the ED. The EKG was consistent with inferolateral wall MI. States that he has been very active without exertional chest pain or dyspnea. He does have a history of HTN and is currently on lisinopril for this. No known history of hypercholesterolemia. Denies any diabetes. No smoking history. No history of PVD. His mother did have a bypass in her early 60s. At age 37, he did have a catherization following an episode of substernal chest discomfort. The patient states this catherization did not show any abnormalities. Following this, the patient proceeded for PCI stenting with a DES for an occluded OM2 . Patient received Aspirin, Brilinta, Atorvastatin, Metoprolol, and Heparin prior to PCI stenting. Cardiology note confirms acute inferolateral STEMI due to occluded OM@, successfully opened and stented acutely.

50 2021-05-28 shortness of breath I had no noticeable issues with my first dose of the Moderna Covid-19 vaccine. I had the following i... Read more
Close
I had no noticeable issues with my first dose of the Moderna Covid-19 vaccine. I had the following issues after my second dose (April 29, 2021): Day 2 (April 30), 28 hours following injection, I experienced an internal feeling of ?jitteriness?, shortness of breath, and accelerated pulse. Pulse oximeter showed my oxygen saturation dropped to 92 percent (my normal is 98-99) and my resting pulse rate increased to 120 bpm (my normal varies from 66 to 75). Aforementioned symptoms subsided after 6 hours. Day 3 (May 1) following injection, local swelling and pain in muscle at site of injection (upper left arm). Arm swelling and pain subsided by Day 7.) Day 4 (May 4), noticed two swollen lymph nodes (size of pea and small marble) near collar bone area of neck (same side as injection). Day 31 (May 29), both lymph node swellings still exists (as of this reporting) though not as prominent.

Fever, fatigue, dizziness, headache, sore muscles and joints, rapid heart beat, tingling and burning sensation in hands and feet and increased tinnitus lasted for 3 weeks. Ongoing - sore muscles, joints and tendons, tingling/burning sensation in hands and feet, cold hands and feet, muscle fatigue and tiredness since 4/12/2021 and ongoing today.

Final diagnosis was perimyocarditis and I received a prescription of Colchicine 0.6 MG to be taken twice a day for 6 weeks and then follow up with a cardiologist.

51 2021-01-06 shortness of breath I experienced insidous onset of rapid heart rate with palpitations after approximately 2-3 minutes o... Read more
Close
I experienced insidous onset of rapid heart rate with palpitations after approximately 2-3 minutes of inoculation. This episode lasted about 1-2 minutes. I was not expecting this having no prior history of adverse response to vaccines. I also felt a flushing sensation in my head. My breathing felt slightly more difficult. No sweating, throat closure or itching. I did not measure pulse and instead tried to breathe/meditate to bring it down. I estimate it was about 140 bpm . Breathing/meditation brought it down but it was still elevated when the nurse checked me after 20 minutes. I remained onsite an additional 15 minutes until I felt well enough to leave but my heart rate was still somewhat elevated, about 20 bpm higher than my usual. My heart rate seemed to fluctuate throughout the evening and my sleep was subsequently very poor. I feel much better this morning, just the usual arm soreness after a vaccination. I have reached out to my primary doctor concerning whether she feels this event would warrant my not getting the second dose or perhaps having a prescribed epipen on my person. Having no personal history but a family history of severe heart disease (father had first MI at age 42, second at 44 followed by triple bypass and CHF) this incident with my heart rate certainly raised some anxiety. I had a routine EKG done in June which was normal, I am a physical therapist and in good health. I am hoping to have the next vaccine in a proper medical facility. I have read CDC recommendations to not have the second shot if certain adverse responses are experienced and I am not certain whether this would qualify. I have no history of adverse reactions to vaccines. Considering the role of anxiety versus the insidious and nearly immediate onset of rapid heart rate with palpitations and persistent elevated heart rate for more than 12 hours, I feel this event was primarily driven by the vaccine.

I had Covid-19 with symptoms beginning on 11/16/2020 and had shortness of breath along with crackles and chest tightness during the second week of illness. The oxygen level declined to 92-93%. I was treated with steroids and azithromycin at that time and the tightness of the chest resolved by about day 17 of illness. I am reporting this adverse effect (chest tightness and shortness of breath) because it may be an autoimmune reaction triggered by the response to the vaccine.

Patient received first dose of vaccine prior to two weeks to his death (died on 09 Mar 2021). A week prior to his vaccination as shortness of breath, weakness, diffuse chest tightness, confusion, and dizziness. These symptoms progressed following his vaccination and he was hospitalzed for two days prior to his death on 09 Mar 2021. Treatment information was not provided. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not applicable. The patient died on 09 Mar 2021 The cause of death was reported as cardio/pulmonary failure with secondary and tertiary causes of hypertension and obesity. Plans for an autopsy were not provided. The outcome of the events, cardiac failure and pulmonary failure were fatal.; Reporter's Comments: This is a case of death in a 51-year-old male subject with a medical history of HTN, obesity, bee allergy and bipolar disorder,who died 7 days after receiving first dose of vaccine. Close
Approximately 30 minutes after the vaccine, while driving home, my chest area started to feel very warm, then I started to have difficulty breathing. I was unable to swallow for the first minute or so, then my upper and lower lip got numb. After I was able to swallow my saliva tasted metallic and a mental fog settled in. I had difficulty concentrating for the next 2-3 minutes. All symptoms lasted for about 5 minutes. About a week later I developed a skin rash reminiscent to a "zoster." It was the size of my palm on my left thigh. Although is almost clear now, the affected skin area lost some sensitivity. Another subcutaneous inflammation persist to present day.
